text: From Mikkeller And Friends Bottle Shop in Copenhagen: pours mahagony with pretty beige head. Aroma is yeast, complex fruitiness, some earthiness. Nice dry hoppy bite. Low sweetness. Excellent mouthfeel. I get scared of BSAs these days because of sugar or imbalance risks, but this pulls it off without flaw. Reminds you why these beers inspired a generation.

Finally able to rate this one, not that I havent tasted it enough already but In finally reminded this one was still left unrated.. . Sweet rounded creamy aroma with hints of malt and a slight touch of grapefruit. Smooth mouthfeel, initialy sweet, fruity, evolving into a roasted dry malt finish, which lingers for quite some time. Complex, powerfull but perfectly balanced beer. Superior to the Twelve in my opinion and the best dark Trappist.

From bottle at the abbey; pours cloudy, nearly muddy dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma is malty, grainy and slightly yeasty. Taste is light to medium bitter, slightly sweet, caramel, yeasty, bread and some dark fruits, slightly herbal. Medium bitter, light yeasty finish. Fizzy carbonation, medium to full body. I really like it!

Det skal siges at det er en fantastisk øl, det er slet ikke det. Det er ikke den samme øl, du skal ikke lede efter noget som smager i denne stil. Hvis du leder efter en 8er som er ren, så er det ikke her, men hvis du leder efter en 8er som skubber til dig, led ikke efter andet. Den er klasse.

Appearance: red, brown, hazy, white-tan foam, rocky head, lasts long. Aroma: wheat, bread, alcohol,caramel, toffee? Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, well balanced. Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, astringent, medium bitter rather long finish.

33cl not sure if it was on tap or from bottle at the Abbey of Westvleteren.
Aromas of dried fruits, prune, figs, dates, a bit dark chocolate and coffee.
Poured dark reddish brown with a beige creamy small head, which faded.
Taste had the dried fruits again, maybe some cherry as well, a bit of boozy warmth.

33cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Brown colour with a frothy tan head.
Aroma is malt, molasses, prune, figs, berries.
Taste is malt, caramel, brown sugar, prune, syrup, slightly spicy.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Uzupełnienie ocen, pite kilka lat temu. W aromacie mocno melasa i lekka paloność. Smak słodki, lekka goryczka.

A: Caramel brown with a big tan head
N: Chocolate, dates, coffee, 
T: A tapestry of spices. Bitter dark chocolate, some faint floral notes
P: Full
O: Great abbey brown

33 cL bottle. Pours a murky brown color, with a big, foamy, tan head that refuses to go away. The aroma is smooth juniper, butter toffee, allspice, dates, and molasses. Fairly sweet up front, drying out a bit toward the finish, with a smooth bitterness that lingers. Medium body, with a velvety, grainy feel and a bit of a bite. Almost a year old, and it still seems a little young. A bit sharp and assertive, but very pleasant, and a little more time would probably smooth it out some. Simple and easy at first, but layered and subtly complex. Nearly perfect flavor. Thoroughly enjoyable.

A bottle from Beers of Belgium drunk at Dads place while home on leave. Aroma: plums, wine. Appearance: hazy dark brown, minimal head. Palate: full-bodied and creamy, average carbonation. Long, predominantly sweet finish. Taste: heavily sweet, but pleasantly so. Delicious boozy flavour, almonds in there somewhere. Complex and excellent.

How: bottle Appearance: light brown with a red shimmer, medium off-white head. Aroma: lots of dried fruits; dates,figs, prunes, raisins, some spice, herbs, nuts, caramel, dark syrup, grass, plums, blackberries, some yeast. Palate: full body, soft carbonation. Very nice.

Good flavor and color with an overall pleasant experience. It was nice to get my hands on this beer in the US. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 Botella 33 cl en el Kraken 21..04..2017. (r2083). Sin lote ni Fcpref legibles en chapa. Color marrón oscuro con poca espuma beige oscuro que desaparece casi por completo al poco. Sabores intensos maltosos ligeramente tostados algo secos al final con predominio de frutos pasos pan de higos, galletas y ligeras especias. Cuerpo medio a intenso con 8 vol y buena sensación alcohólica. Bastante buena aunque algo más seca y menos dulce que la 12. Así con todo para repetir.

Yummy Dubbel, classic and refined yet surprisingly accessible, sweet and chock full of dark fruit goodness but firm and spicy on the back end. Notes of dried cherry and caramel mingle with dates and clove, leading to a modestly hoppy finish laced with yeast and a slight hit of warmth. Somewhat simple, yet theres a purity in its simplicity, as good and true an example of a Dubbel as you could want. Nose gives up sweet toffee and a little raisin, and the pour is beautiful, dark red-brown with ample head and lacing. Feel is traditional Belgian fiestiness. Solid Trappiste ale.

Aroma: caramel, alcohol, some dried fruits, figs and spicy notes
Taste: moderate sweet, figs, caramel, alcohol, some prunes

Bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown color with a foamy taupe colored head. Mouthfeel finishes also dry but has some medium weight to it. Notes of dark caramel, figs, cola, and nuts. Delicious and understated in a way.
Funky sticky toffee goodness. Murky brown with a small beige head and ample soft prickly carbonation.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours dark amber-brown with small head. aroma: caramel, malty candy- mean sweet, some rye notes, brown sugar, dark grapes, weak belgian yeast, Taste; swet with some sourness and mouth burning alcohol, candy, caramel, yeasty, some bread. Medium pluss body. Soft carbo. Not for me. Maybe to warm but....

Muddy brown, moderate ivory head. Well-lacing. The aroma is very estery, nutty, lots of dried fruit, lollipop. Very noble. Medium to full body. The flavour is powerful, relatively dry. Very nutty. Solid esters. Caramel. Light bitterness. A little bit astringent. This is an incredible brew.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle bought at In de Vrede. Brownish colour with a small head. Lots of carbonation. malty caramel aroma with hints of raisins and plums. Medium body and a Nice finish. Very drinkable.
Like Anglefood and Rum Cakes had a baby that grew up to marry the perfect coffee-like finish. Wow.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 26D). Bottle 33 cl - Batch uknown (BBF 14.07.19). AROMA: balanced and complex notes of medium peppery alcohols, molasses, caramel, slight cherry, plums, honey and cinammon. medium malty background with a caramel-like character. APPEARANCE: very dark ambar color and clear. large moussy light brown head with good retention. lace formation. TASTE: balanced and similar to the aroma but more balanced towards the caramel-like flavors (molasses, caramel), slight peppery alcohols, dried plums and a dark caramel malt background. medium-low bitterness with a dry finish. PALATE: medium body with high carbonation. slight alcohol warmth but smooth. OVERALL: a very good (and rare) trappist belgian ale. recommended.

W wyglądzie ciemnobrązowe z średniopęcherzykową pianą, dośc szybko zanikła do zera. W aromacie fenole, estry, ciemne owoce- srednio intensywne. W smaku ciemne owoce, fenole, nuty nalewki, dośc, złożone piwo o średnim ciele. Miało urwać co nieco, ale może flaszka nie taka, może nie ten dzien piwowara ale nie urwało niestety...

Creamy beige head stayed well on a still dark brown body. 
Rich aroma of dark berries, brown sugar, malt & dark spirits. 
Medium bodied smooth but with very fine carbonation on the tongue. Clean on the back. 
Berries, demerara, malt, chocolate & caramel tastes with a long bitter/sweet boozy finish.
959517

Bottle poured into a taster showing half a finger of tanned white foam and moderately filled dark caramel. 

The nose shows pears, figs, and light caramelized apples with an astringent tea line profile. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated with a rich clean foamy mouthfeel. Flavors of dry caramel and black sugar with no sweetness. Very light alcoholic spiciness.

Bottle at home. 2016 vintage bought at the brewery. Sweet, spicy and yeasty taste with a perfect light bitterness at the end. Taste of cinnamon buns, black pepper, fruit syrup, toast and herbs. Elegant.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

W aromacie fenole, estry, rodzynki, figi, drożdże, ciemny chleb, ciemne owoce, wanilia, drewno. W wyglądzie ciemna miedź z lekką beżową pianką. W smaku figi, rodzynki, ciemne owoce, fenole, nuty nalewki, szlachetnych trunków, melasa, złożone i przyjemne. Ciało średnie, degustacyjne, alkohol ukryty, słodkie z wytrawną kontrą. Perfekcyjnie ułożone. Bardzo dobre piwo.
Brown. Bread aroma. Sandy palate. Yeasty. Ripe fruits. Sophisticated. I want some cheese with this.

Oui cest bon.
Nez porté sur le caramel, des épices, très fruitée (fraise, framboise, abricot sec). Un côté amande genre frangipane. Le tout est très équilibré.
Bouche plus épicée et typique trappiste. Assez compliquée à décomposer. On est un rien déçu vu le bouquet fabuleux.

Bottle at the monastery/brewery with commonshawn, rosskyle, samalito, and dubtully. Plum color with off white head. Aroma carries dark fruit at the forefront. Taste reminds me of a lighter version of a quad with dark fruit, sugars, malt. Surprisingly drinkable for the higher ABV. Clean mouthfeel with a bit of alcohol warmth and bite. Boozy without overwhelming the overall experience. This falls under the large shadow of its bigger brother but worthy of nearly equal praise. Good work, monks.
Medium dark brown with a lasting head. Taste is lots of red wine and chocolate. Fairly sweet and heavy.

Bottle in Ghent. Dark plum color with thick off white head. Tart dark fruit nose. Very complex flavor. Plum, slightly raisin, tart, some yeast, . Rich. Heavy sweetness, well balanced. Currant. Good booziness. Might have had an older bottle. Still excellent.

Aroma: like old barn, very old. Taste: something very old, like feeling taste from centuries ago. This is extraordinary, unique. Feels like very aged beer. Excellently balanced, quite shocking to drink such beer. Never forget it.

Barwa ciemno br?zowa z bardzo delikatnymi, rubinowymi refleksami. Piana bia?a, pojawia si? zaledwie na chwilk?.
Aromat: delikatne nuty czkoladowe, delikatnie palone, owocowe akcenty, które muszaj? si? z aromatem kakao i pralinek, wanilii i marcepanu.
Smak: jest podobnie jak w aromacie, ciemne owoce, pralinki i kakao. Ponownie pojawia si? marcepan mieszaj?cy si? z wanilia.
Nasycenie ?rednie w kierunku do niskiego.

Bottle. Dark Brown in colour. Very malty (roast malts, chocolate, caramel/toffee, dark sugar). Fruity (dark fruits, raisins, plums, dates). Very spicy (and peppery). Yeasty (lots of floaties), earthy. Sweet with a slight bitter edge. Dryish bittersweet finish. Great depth of flavour. Complex. Wonderful beer! (2008)

Appearance: Dark mahogany brown body with tiny flecks floating in the body. A tiny bit amber in the pour. Thick off-white/beige head, easily 3 fingers.

Smell: Fruity at first with some zest. Cloves, herbs and my wife smells rosemary also.

Taste: Big time herb presence with lots of spice and some dried fruit. The spices are a little overpowering, dry and a little rough. A little harsh, almost like eating a stem or some herbs. As it warms, it calms down a little at least and has some sherry presence but i still find it a little unbalanced for my taste. Not at all what i was expecting. Wheres the malt presence & the sweetness?

Mouthfeel: Fair amount of carbonation but bitter on the palate. Again, better as it warms and a small improvement but it is still impeded by the taste.
Pours dark with red flashes. Big head. Small bubbles. Dry fruits in aroma, light alcohol. Dry. Lively.
Nice brown beer with 8% alcochol but with the sweetness of a much stronger dark beer.

Dark mahogany. Spicy and phenolic, with caramel, kandis and dried fruit. Solid aroma and rich flavour. Sweet taste that finishes dry and lightly bitter. Light/medium body, and foamy carbonation. Overall, a great dark belgian ale. It is rich, tasty, balanced and drinkable. Yes, it is very good, but so are many others like it, and I believe the exclusive character of this beer has inflated the ratings.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2017 33cl bottle at home from Mariana as a gift, many thanks! Nose is dried fruits. Body is dark brown, head is very big, beige, creamy, fully lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is grape, raisin, milk chocolate, biscuits, caramel, cherry. Medium sweet, light bitter, hint of fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity medium sweet, light alcohol warmth. Medium body, creamy texture, average lasting. Easy fruity beer, very interesting, well balanced, great one.

Brown dark ruby with a finger of head. Bold fortified fruit brandy taste and bit like red wine with some flaky malty twist. Not boozy though. A little sticky with an interesting dryness, peanuts maybe, and more red wine taste but not sweet. A nice beer with a great story but far from my favorite.
Bottle 330ml . Dark brownbeer with off white head. Malty, caramelly aroma, caramel and fruit. Sweet and complex taste. Low carbonation. Me like.
I know its a cheek but I loved this beer. Goosebumps when I first tried it. Its a very well balanced, nice and soft beer with a great aroma (nutty hints). Loved it.
Flaska från beer temple, brygge. Mörk bärnstensfärgad vätska med beiget skum. Doft av kakao, torkad frukt, knäck och jäst. Söt smak med äpple, torkad frukt, sirap och jäst. Mustig och djup.
Flaska från Matte. Mörkt brun med beige skum. Mustig doft av russin, bränt socker, torkad frukt. Torr och inte så söt med rejäl smak av torkad frukt, karamell och kakor.
330 ml bottle. Dark golden brown with off white head. Spicy, fruity with dark fruit, ripe fruit, caramel and yeast. Semi sweet with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Piwo brunatne z drobno pęcherzykową, grubą, beżową pianą, zdobi szkło. Aromat - średnio intensywny, karmelowy, jakby lekko piernikowy, lekkie rodzynki. Smak - sporo słodyczy, karmelu, bardzo przyprawowe, jakby korzenne, alkohol świetnie ukryty. Goryczka symboliczna ale wyczuwalna. Wysycenie średnie, w sam raz. Posmak długi, słodki, ciasteczkowy, lekko grzeje w przełyk. Świetne piwo ale do doskonałości Westvleteren XII mu daleko. Butelka ze starej partii. Leżała u mnie ze dwa lata.
Bottle 330ml. Chestnut brown with a lightly beige head. Malty aroma, turning more fruity when temperature increases. Very carbonated. Taste is bready and full of sweet pears. Ong smooth finish.
Niet zo goed als de 12, maar toch zeker een erg lekker biertje. Niet heel erg uitgesproken in smaak of aroma, maar juist door zijn subtiliteit een uitblinker.
Bottle in a restaurant in front of the brewery. Good paired with the cheese plate. Full bodied strong ale.

BE 21.08.17. Dark brown, hazy beer with good and long lasting head. Aroma has Belgium yeast, sugar malts, bread and licorice. Taste has bread, malts, Belgium yeast, spicies and dried fruits. Spicyness gets stronger at the end. Also licorice and anis is more strong at the end. Medium body, low carbonation.

Bottle. Trappist glass. Brown, like coffee diluted wit lots of water. Small, light brown, head which disappears quite quickly. Poor head retention and lacing. Aroma i moderately to highly sweet (mainly caramel, some brown sugar notes), moderately spicy and fruity (plums, some raisins). Taste is moderately to heavy sweet with light bitterness, shirt, unstable. Medium to full body, oily texture, very lively carbonation, finish is semi-dry, bitter, spicy and caramel. Summary: Palate and appearance are below average. Aroma is mainly spicy, caramel, dark fruits. In general very drinkable, well hidden ABV, very lively carbonation. IMHO overrated beer. Ok, the very nice combination of spices, malts (caramel) with great drinkability, but the aroma and taste are only good, not perfect. Podsumowanie: Wysoce pijalne, przyprawowe, dobrze zbalansowane belgian strong ale, ale to nie perfekcja i nie numer jeden, niestety. Natomiast nie patrząc z perspektywy RB gone polecenia jam dobre belgian strong ale z wyraźnymi belgijskimi klimatami (drożdże, przyprawy).

Poured a deep reddish brown with a dense off white head. Aroma of roast malt, dark alcohol soaked fruit and some candy sweetness. Medium body, vanilla smooth, flavour of light cherry, red berries, very easy to drink with a pleasantly alcoholic buzz in the aftertaste.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Anyż, plakatówki, karmel i potworne przegazowanie.

Bottle (02.12.18). Mahogany body, tall steady head. Nutty aroma with light raisins and yeast esters. Weak herbal hops. Smooth classic Dubbel flavours - nuttiness, yeast, raisins. Soft finish, at times even feels less intense than Id like it to be. Good balance but in overall its not better than other Trappist Dubbels which are always available and for a reasonable price. I wish people stopped overrating hard to get beers just because they paid a lot of money for it.

W aromacie sporo aldehydu octowego, estry, troszkę suszonych owoców, karmel. W smaku przypieczona skórka od chleba, rodzynki, karmel i spora nieprzyjemna nuta alkoholowa. Z całej trójki moim zdaniem najgorsze.

Taste: Bold, bread, rye, malts, roasted notes with dark fruit like plums and alcohol finish. Dark bread rye nose. Mahogany, clear, big foamy head with sticky lace. Medium/full body. A robust Belgian ale with traditional yeasts.

We shared a bottle between seven people, so my tasting was tiny and sure to be inaccurate :P. Brown color, sample too small to gauge carbonation. Lovely aroma of bananas, chocolate, alcohol, grain husks. Flavor is fruity, sharp, burnt, boozy, lots of spicy phenols. Ill call it smooth, despite its hard edges (they we not unpleasant) Starts sweet finishes bitter. Very good, worth a revisit with a larger sample, if I can ever find one.

Bottle at Gollem Cafe. Dark red color with an off white head. Light citrus fruit aroma. Choc plum sweet caramel nutty malt flavor. Heavy body. Awesome.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle at Taphouse Munich. Aroma is slightly peach, almond, light pineapple, malty. Appearance is dark cloudy brown with a thick brown-ish foam
 Taste is medium sweet, light bitter. Dry. Soft carbonation. Stays bitter. Long finish. Great.

2010 bottle. Pours an amber colour with a thin off-white head. Aroma of raisins and figs, with a bit of nuttiness. Tastes fairly sweet and date-like, with a touch of oxidation. Very nice and well integrated flavours.
Bottl - Vintage 2010 - Nutty and honey notes. Cloudy brown with small off white head. Honey and sweet nutty with a long malty finish.

Pours a dark brown color with a persistenf hick foamy, beige head. Aroma is caramel, spices, cloves, dark fruits, esters and alcohol. Taste is sweet caramel, dark fruits, roasted malts, raisins. Full body, mild carbonation, sweet, lingering finish.
Shared 33cl bottle. Pours dark brown with a persistent light beige head. Aroma of fruit, malt, spice, bread. Taste is dark fruit, malt, spice, bread, yeast. Very good.

Es isch schwer zu sagen ob es so extrem gut schmeckt weil es etwas so besonderes ist odr weil es wirklich so ist :)
Klar abr ein Top Bier! Mehr auf foobee.ch

Bottle aged 25 years, shared by Cathy Villa. Deep plummy Amber brown. Big fig and date aroma thats soft but full and semisweet. Soft but big date and fig flavor thats gently boozy but soft and rounded and perfect. Just a great rounded and smooth brew thats full of dark purple fruits (date might be most prominent with a small dash of coconut)

Offert par Nutjes.
Bouteille de 33 cl.
Couleur Marron type café, châtaigne.
mousse inexistante.
Au nez cest intéressant : note de raisin secs , malte torréfié , une pointe de sucre.
En bouche les fruits secs sont bien present je trouve , raisin sec , noix de cajou , un peu de châtaigne? et un pouvoir sucrant Type sucre candy ?
excellent et juste .

Bottle. Shared with Lena. Brown with medium tan head. Good lacing. Aroma of dark fruits and some banana, yeast and some sugar. Taste is very good. Booze is hidden, dark fruits and some brown sugar. Nothing bad to say about this taste.

Bottle @home. Pours brown, red tinge, ever so slightly murky, a good sized tan head and great lacing. Nose is fruity, red wine, raisin, slight esters some banana. Taste is fruit cake, raisin, dates, slight clove, cinnamon as it warms big prune taste comes through.
Bottle in Mort Subite in Altrincham. Pours ruby with a foamy beige head. Sweet fruity aroma. The taste is rich and complex. Ripe red fruits, toffee, leather, liquorice, plum, dry spice. Excellent.

33cl-fles samen met Banzale. U: Wazig donkerbruin met beige schuimkraag. G: Chocolade, rozijnen, toffee en kandijsuiker. S: Karamelzoet, chocolade, gedroogd fruit, kandijsuiker en een moutbittere afdronk. M: Volmondig en medium carbonatie

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2016 Pours a hazy deep brown from the bottle at the cafe with fluffy tan head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma of dark fruits from the yeast playing with the malts, hint of burnt sugar, and a bit of booze. Taste follows, booze is hidden, but nice Belgian dark fruity esters and dark sugars. Really nice and clean for the abv, better than the 12 in my opinion.

Bottle, shared by/with M, thanks! BB 02.12.2018. Pours cloudy rusty chestnut with great beige head. Strong lace. Excellent plummy aroma, strong brown liquor without the alcohol. Toffeey, plus grassy hints. Tastes toasty malty sweet with plummy liquor and a bit of stimulating bitterness. Soft on the palate. Fine carbonation. Lovely stuff... but not quite on a 4/5 level. Should probably give it more time.

I hope I can keep a bottle of the same batch for many years, 2 at least...

Bottle at The Sovereign. Murky medium brown with small ecru head. Dark fruit, sweet malt, dates, raisins, yeast, lite candy. Complex and deep. More approachable than its big brother, and more drinkable. Still a huge beer, though. Awesome.
Flesje gekregen met verjaardag. Donkerbruin, troebel bier met gistvlokken. Aroma van donker fruit en kruiden. Smaak is zoetig, hoppig en heerlijk fruitig. Jammer dat de smaak snel wegebt.

Bevuta dopo pochi giorni rispetto alla più blasonata XII mi ha riservato una piacevole sorpresa. Ha un sapore intrigante forse leggermente meno equilibrato ma piuttosto complesso e pieno di fascino. Notevole.

This is my 300th entry on RateBeer. I am celebrating and tasting a glass of Westy 8 for this special moment:) Bottle from BelgianShop.com. Pours a hazy deep brown colour with one finger of lasting head. Complex aroma with notes of raisin, plums, dark cherries, toffee and a hint of oak barrel. The taste starts off dry and hoppy then leads to a robust malty finish. Medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and high carbonation. Excellent dubbel!

Bottle at a tasting. Thanks to Lukka19! Interesting mix of dark fruity esters and slightly cloveish phenolics. Intense in both aroma and flavour. Very high carbonation yet foam kept in check. Easy drinking. Quite good.

Bottle. Dark brown color. Medium white head. Aroma of berries, dried fruits, nuts, caramel, light spicy, notes of herbs and honey. Taste is solid malty, sweet, caramel, spices, berries, dried fruits. Good balanced
Bottle shared by lukka19, thanks. Pours brown color, lightly beige head. Aroma is Sweet, bit yeasty, caramel, some candies. Taste is sweet, lightly bitter, caramel, bit yeasty, candies.

Aroma: dry and spicy but not particularly complex; Appearance: very dark amber/cola pour with thin white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: rich, malty, spicy, dry; yummy; Palate: medium-heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: quite good but I think I still prefer Rochfort 8. Would definitely get again when available.

Had this a couple of months ago at In-der-Vrede café just across the street from the monastery. so I will be reviewing the other 2 options. Came already served in a chalice, brownish / red with very thin foam on top.

Aromas of candies and burnt sugar; first taste is of candied fruits and caramel, licorice and many more that I cannot recall from memory.

A great beer.

Bottle, I believe it was April 2013 if I remember correctly. Pours a dark and cloudy brown/amber color, bit of red, medium foamy tan head, some yeast floaties from cellaring, though I tried to pour slowly. Aroma of caramel, dark fruits, black licorice, banana, clove, alcohol. Full body, thicker texture, heavy carbonation, finish of alcohol and almost a spiciness with the heavy carbonation. Maybe I waited a bit too long on this bottle? I thought between 2 and 5 years was ok, even tho the cap date says within 3 years I think.

Deep clear red pour with a single finger head. Aroma of figs and coca-cola with a hint of cherry. Finish has some caramel and toffee. A little alcohol heat in the throat. Light bodied. Taste has cherries, caramel, toffee, figs and other stone fruits. I dont think Ive ever had a beer this complex. Just a lot going on here. Sweet, but finishes dry. Im pretty sure I like this better than the XII, which everyone goes wild for.

F: big, off-white, good retention.
C: dark brown, opaque, hazy.
A: dark malt, sweet, candy, syrupy, molasses, brown sugar, chestnut, dark fruits, caramel, cardamom, yeast.
T: malt, molasses, candy, spearmint, brown sugar, light woody, dark fruits, liquorice, cardamom, yeasty, grassy bitterness, toffee, caramel, light chocolate, medium full body, good carbonation, very similar to St. Bernardus 12 vintage 2006, but yes a great beer, 0,33l on tap @ In de Vrede 8. June 2016
Bottle at Home. Pours dark hazy Brown with a off White head. Aroma of yeast, dried plums, light licorice,light marzipan. Taste is rather sweet with loads of dried fruits and yeast. Good

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2016 From a bottle at home. Dark brown with lots of sediment inside. Thin white head and a nice sweet aroma. Taste is dark fruits, caramel, quite sweet but not overwhelmingly. Lightly carbonated and overall it deserves every praise that it got over the years. This beer is something special and well worth the ?12 that I paid for it.

Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się grubo pęcherzykowa, sycząca piana, która szybko opada do firanki. Barwa miedziano brązowa, mętna, z pływającymi drobinkami. W aromacie królują suszone owoce (rodzynki, daktyle, figi, gruszki), cukier kandyzowany, karmel, melasa, wosk pszczeli, odrobina przypraw... W smaku podobnie, dość słodko, tu na pierwszy plan wychodzi miód spadziowy, miód gryczany, wosk pszczeli, głóg i rodzynki. Goryczka średnia, lekko pikantna, ziołowo przyprawowa. W posmakach można doszukać się porto, wanilii, toffi... Wysycenie średnie do wysokiego, drobne, odczucie w ustach półpełne, treściwe, puszyste. Alkohol pięknie ukryty.
Bardzo dobre piwo, słodkie, intensywne, treściwe, do powolnej degustacji. Zasłużona wysoka pozycja w rankingach, choć dla mnie nieco zbyt miodowo woskowe...
Pours a dark red brown colour. Taste is quite breast and of Belgian yeast. Bottle at Mike_77s house

The aroma of yeast and raisins. Much alcohol, yeast, raisins and a little caramel taste. Not so good bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Very much carbonic acid. The alcohol makes the beer becomes difficult to drink. Do not live up to their expectations, unfortunately, as the worlds best Belgian ale. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours dirty brown with a small white fizz. Aroma is raisin, plum and earthy malt with loads of yeast floaties. Taste is nice and complex, raisin, plum, caramel and yeasty back. Nice sipper.

Pours a burnt amber brown color with an off white head. Caramel, toffee, yeast, molasses, funk and dark fruit aroma. Caramel, toffee, yeast, molasses, funk, fig, raisin, plum and toast flavors. Medium body and lively carbonation with a dark fruit, molasses and yeast finish.

Marrom de alta turbidez, espuma marrom de boa formação e média persistência. Malte em grande quantidade, passas, figo, chocolate, frutada, complexa. No paladar médio dulçor e leve amargor. Corpo e carbonatação médio. Final de média/longa persistência, trás um amargor torrado, mantém o chocolate amargo, passas.

Mörkt brun. En härlig doft och ett djup i smakerna. Lite söt, lite skumbanan, toffee. En öl jag skulle kunna dricka ofta, men det blir både krångligt och dyrt! Weltklasse!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown with an off white. Smell of dry fruit (raisins). Big thick Christmas cakes flavours with a smooth finish. A lovely beer.

Rated by BrewTom
Dimmigt mahognybrun med ihållande fint beige-färgat skum. Doftar karamell och malt. Smaken tämligen besk och torr. Eftersmaken nästan bitter, men lång. Drucken på plats i Westvleteren.

330ml bottle: Pours dark brown with a fizzy tan head that clears. Aroma of stone fruit, toffee, slight caramel. Tastes of dark stone fruits with a slight caramel note as well. Very complex but well balanced. Finishes drier than I expected. Fairly bitter with a clean finish. Medium bodied, medium to low carbonation. Overall an absolute peach.

330ml bottle (thanks FatPhilomon Go). Clear dark chestnut color. Small size, off-white head, stays. Raisins, yeasty, alcohol, malty, sweet in aroma. Alcoholic, sweet, raisins, earthy and slightly metallic in taste. Some plasticy elements too. Sweet, yeasty and faint metallic in aftertaste. Sweet and boozy. Distant hops give nice dry mouthfeel and soft bitterness. Soft carbonation. Way too sweet and boozy brew.

Bottle at home, bought a year ago. Pours dark brown, small brown dense head, lots of yeast in the bottle. Nose is deep, dried fruits, brown sugar, some spices, plums, herbs - complex and delicious. Taste is dried fruits, prunes, treacle, raisins, a bit of chocolate, light syrupy, warming alcohol. Very smooth and well balanced. Finish is dryish bitter, dried fruits, even a bit flat feeling although the beer itself is nicely carbonated.

A 330ml bottle with a sell-by date that has unfortunately rubbed off. Poured into a Chimay goblet glass. It poured a dark brown colour with some small sediment bits despite a careful pour. There was a one finger beige head that had pretty good retention and eventually settled to a nice thin but puffy cap and nice curtain like lacing. Aromas of strong dark fruits of plum, prunes, raisin, fig with hints of dark cherry and toffee. Taste was like the aroma, lots of dark fruit with raisin, dark cherry and prunes dominating. Theres also some plum, fig, brown sugar and a touch of alcohol thats not overpowering. Creamy, medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall its a very nice Dubbel. Great dark fruit flavours and very balanced. Interestingly though, after trying both many times, I am still leaning towards enjoying Westmalle Dubbel just that slight bit more.

Hazy dark brown body with yeast floters, medium sized tan head. Aroma of booze, classic belgian stuff, brown sugar. Dried fruit taste, brown sugar, grapes, wine barrel, chocolate, too sweet. lively carbonation, creamy texture, medium body. Little bit unbalanced, carbonation killed me, and too sweet for me. Overall i think its overrated. //bottle, thanks to kajser

Bottle sample tasted at BBF Lab Madrid 2016 on the 02/07/2016. Deep brown colour with a thick creamy off white head. Aroma has tons of caramel and belgian malts. Taste is caramel, malts, dark fruit and yeast. Next one please!
Una de las mejores cervezas que he probado. Notas de caramelo, toffee, bizcocho...

Bouteille 33 cl - couleur brune assez sombre, tête blanche mousseuse qui reste pas, odeur de fruits noir, caramel, goût: caramel, cerise noire, amertume nulle, douceur, réchauffe la gorge en fin de bouche

Bottle at In de Vrede. Cloudy brown with thin beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, cinnamon, vanilla, light alcohol. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, caramel, light malty. Medium body, average carbonation. Great one.

0.33 bottle. A hazy, dark brown color and a small, off-white head leaving some lacing. Aroma of dark malts and spices - served a bit too cold but it does seem rather simple. Taste of yeasts, fruits, spices, and flowers. A medium body, a creamy texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is medium long and good - nothing to add. Overall the beer is drinkable and tasty, but 12 remains the king for a reason!
Dark amber, creamy brownish head. Aroma from malts, banana, toffee, vanilla and some soursih notes. Flavor is malty with spicy touches and some vanilla and yeast. A great beer.

Thanks to Steve for the bottle. Pours a deep brown with a thick creamy off white head. The aroma is all carmelized sugar and Belgian yeast. Medium body with big carbonation, dark fruit, carmelized sugar and Belgian yeast notes in the taste. Finished clean and tasty. Very good.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2016 2016-12 heerlijk volle pruimen smaak vol moutig en vele esters die door de carbondioxide krachtig blijven hangen in mond en keel.donker rood bruin zacht wit kraagje puur genot. onovertroffen godswonder

Tasted from bottle. Tasted head to head with Westy 12. Pours a dark brown with off white head identical to Westy 12. Aroma is not near as strong but similar. Notes of dark fruits, caramel, maple syrup, toffee. Mouthfeel is a little thinner than Westy 12 but still chewy and sticky. Flavors of brown sugar, maple syrup, figs, plums, raisins, caramel, toffee. Overall excellent for being the little brother to 12. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At In de Vrede. A beautiful hue - burgundy? Frothy lasting beige head. Delicately sweet, tantalizing aroma: dates, figs, brown sugar, Caramel. Flavor follows and brings a moderate earthy bitterness that lasts through the semi dry finish. Not overcarbonated. Excellent.
Very sweet, lighter than expected. Very light, delicate and sweet Aroma. Having a hard time being more specific than that. Very unique and enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 33 cl bottle at de Vrede, Westvleteren. I bought six more bottles in order to age them, so this review might change over time. And it has, indeed. 


First rating: 3.6/5. This is my original review, over a fresh one: "First of all, let me say this is a nice one, but 100? I felt disappointed, given the expectations were high, and loving the Westvleteren 12. Ok, heres the review: pours dark brown with reddish shades. Tan head. Aroma is not particularly high, rather low: honey, violets, dates, prunes, tomato, soy sauce. Mouth is fizzy, medium-bodied, not sweet at all. A little thin. Finish isnt bitter, but it does linger. Lets see within a few years."


OK, A full year has passed, and the conditions of cellaring have been on point. So heres the second review, for a one-year-old one: 5/5. Yes. 33 cl bottle served in large snifter. Pours dark liver brown, tan creamy head. Aroma is medium to high (it has increased over this 365 days) and shows a lot of nuances: dried fruits (prunes, dates, raisins), red berries such as redcurrant or strawberry; cocoa, pipe tobacco, toffee; fig tree leaf, hints of ripe melon (yum!), chicory (rather than coffee), bonfire embers, honey... Immense.
Mouthfeel is still a little fizzy, slick and mouth-covering. Round, creamy and perfectly balanced: no flavour goes over the rest. It displays sweet, tart, savoury, lacteous, metallic and slightly bitter sides, all of them in equilibrium. Oh, yes, this deserves a 100, but you have to be patient and not rush things.

Still have a couple sitting, waiting in the cellar. Maybe well get even further? Is there anything beyond perfection?

Dark brown colour. Modest white head. Plums, dark fruits, caranel, barley, hints of coffee in the aroma. Caramel, dark fruits, hints of barley st first. Plums, hints of berries in the middle. Hints of coffee. Toffee in the end. Quite well balanced, very well drinkable beer. However, it is nothing surprising. Very good, but still a beer from our galaxy.

Brown ale with a thick head. Dark fruit, figs, and dried plum in aroma. Full bodied with fine carbon and thick texture. Taste is weet. The finish covers cinnamon and matured sweet fruits. Una cerveza excelenta que me pareció toda una joya. Notas en donde destacan las maltas obscuras y frutos secos, ligeramente se perciben los sabores característicos de las levaduras belgas y al retrogusto unas notas deliciosas a caramelo y azucar.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2016 Bottle 33cl. Deep dark brown with a huge fluffy off white head. Aroma of malts, wood and brown sugar. The taste is mildly bitter with sweet undertones. The taste slowly develops into a more bitter affair but changes long after every sip. Touches of grain, sugar, chocolate are all present. The carbonation is always present at the tongue.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2016 Bottle at home, tht 21.05.2018. Cloudy chestnut brown colour, creamy beige head that leaves a nice lacing. Roasted caramel malty, dried and ripe fruits (melon), clove, nutmeg, earthy, dry, quite alcoholic tastewise. Lingering complex malty finish, lasts long. Very well balanced. Good body, lively carbonation, soft mouthfeel.
Cloudy, dark brown with a frothy tan head. Yeasty banana and alcohol aroma. Taste is sweet malt, yeast, dried fruit.

Cloudy red-brown. Very faint malt aroma. Flavour is bitter with a hit of malt and theres a good whack of chocolate in there too. Lively on the tongue. Not much of a backtaste. Its nice but somehow a touch unsubstantial.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2016 Bottle 33cl bought at Schaliënhuis Temse. Pours hazy dark brown with a medium beige creamy head. Nose: roasted malts, hints of maple sirup, chocolate, caramel, dried fruits, alcoholic flavour in my nose, spicy, orange zeste. Taste: slightly sweet taste (maple sirup/dried fruits) with notes of orange zeste and some caramel en chocolate in combination with a creamy feeling and a warm alcoholic feeling with the adding of a spicy touch. The aftertaste is pretty malty, half dry, light bitter notes.
Again I did not enjoyed this beer to the fullest...
Overall: Milk chocolate, sweet raisins.Note: Bottle 330 ml. (Vintage 2002) Reviewed 2016-04-10.

27/03/2016 - 33cl glass @ In de Vrede, Westvleteren.
Dark brown with a nice tanned creamy head. Nose is dark roasted malts, fruits, caramel.Taste is dark malts, grains, caramel, fruits. Silky mouthfeel. Nice

33cl bottle. Very dark ruby pour, hazy and witg a fine tan head that gives way to a thick lacing. Smells of dark fruit, dried fruit, caramel and yeast. Tastes bitter-sweet, with notes of cocoa, chocolate, dried fruit, cola. Soft mouthfeel, medium to high carbonation.

Brown color, high pillowy head. Aroma cloves, wheat, caramel. Palate watery and carbonation medium. Alcoholic, sweet fondane, milk chocolate. Finish sweeter than I would like. Ok, but nothing exceptional.

Rating #1116, flaske fra The Bottle Shop i Brügge  

Rigtig flot grumset brun øl med højt, mediumtæt og holdbart skum. Der er ikke meget at sætte en finger på, første gang man ser øllet. Duften er også rigtig lækker med en vis ristethed, en lang række ubestemmelige krydderier og gær. Den kunne dog være noget tydeligere. Smagen er lækker maltet med en del modne frugter, men mere tør end sød. Til slut er en bismag af nellike til at understøtte det hele. Forholdsvis bitter uden at være for voldsom. Cremet og fyldig. Bestemt en rigtig god øl, men alligevel en smule overvurderet med sine 4.2 i snit.

Had the rare opportunity that it was offered to me by someine who does not care about beer and had it lying in the basement. Was almost expired, so even very well aged. And this was easily noticable in the huge complexity of this one. Oh yeah! It had developed a lovely very subtle sourness like sour/wild ale. That on top of the warmth of the abey ale made this a wonderful experience. Only the mouthfeel was a bit thin. But then again, maybe I drank too much Russian Imperials lately.
Bottle: good solid belgian ale, found it in Guatemala in Birra Bier. Unfortunately its too expensive for just a good ale.
UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 Color oscuro, limpio, espuma abundante y duradera. Olor a caramelo, dulce. Sabor a levadura, dulce, maltosa, cremosa. Equilibrada. Muy recomendable.

Efter sigende en af verdens bedste øl, og ikke uden grund.
Meget fyldig i smag, har mange aromaer og har en meget blød og ikke særlig humlet eftersmag. Dens eftersmag er meget lang også.

Bottle. Thanks to Frank (Bartlebeer) Brown clear body with white head. Aroma is is dried fruits, yeast, almonds some sugar and spices. Taste is first sweet then yeasty fruity and some bitterness. Aftertaste is is nice bitter slightly balanced by some malty sweetness with some alcohol. Was expecting a little bit more.

Bouteille. Nez de levures assez fruitées (cerises noires et rouges, prunes, raisins aux notes vineuses, léger de figues avec des notes de pommes), malté de caramel toffee (notes terreuses) et de sucre brun avec des notes de miel, épicé (clou de girofle, notes poivrées), de chocolat, de houblon herbeux et dalcool doux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture crémeuse et riche. Goût de levures assez fruitées (cerises noires et rouges, raisins vineux, prunes, léger de pommes et de figues, notes dabricots - qui reste présent en fond toute la gorgée) avec un goût épicé (clou de girofle, notes de poivre) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de caramel toffee sucré (légèrement terreux) et moyen de sucre brun et des notes de chocolat noir, de pain, de biscuits et de miel parallèlement à un goût moyennement amer de houblon herbeux, dalcool doux et aux notes sèches de levures et dépices (poivre). Arrière-goût long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux, dalcool doux et de levures avec un fruité (moût de raisins vineux et de cerises, pelures de prunes et de pommes). [notes 2006]

Bière bue In de Vrede, Belle mousse beige onctueuse, une couleur brune ambrée , arôme malts ,levure. Au goût malt torréfié, levures, raisins secs, lamertume du houblon est légère, finale sèche. Une jolie bière dabbaye. 33Cl

33 cl bottle at home. Pours unclear brown with medium off-white, pillowy head. Aroma: dried dark fruits, brown sugar, butterscotch, spices. Taste: Starts of with high sweetness. Finish is low in sweetness with high bitterness. Finish is bitter and a little dry. Notes of coffee, dark fruits and roasted nuts. Texture is creamy with soft carbonation. Very nice and balanced.
Really great beer. Life is too short to drink cheap beer was one of reasons I had to taste it, dont regret it.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2016 Aroma: Caramel, dark fruits.
Appearance: Brown, hazy, tan 2-fingers head.
Taste: Medium/heavy sweet, fruity, very complex.
Palate: Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, long sweet finish.
Overall: Little brother of Westy 12; it has everything but it is just not so "big beer".
Aroma has anise, caramel candy and liquorice. Flavor has an awesome caramel flavor, liquorice, umami, slight roastiness. Balanced finish. - From Backlog
At the Westvleteren cafe "In de Vrede" on the beginning of May 2013. Pours dark brown. Aroma with sweet dark fruits notes, caramel, brown sugar, roasted malts and yeast. Good balanced and delicious.
Gedronken in In De Vrede. Mooi donkerbruin bier. Aroma en smaak van mout, gedroogd fruit. Voldoende koolzuur, drinkt heerlijk weg.

Aroma: carmel, Liquorice, dark fruits
Taste: carmel, toffee, Liquorice, spice, molasses

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wow. En øl med sjæl. Superlækker smag. Lækker frisk øl. Kan absolut anbefales.

Bottle acquired from a shop in Bruges. Medium off white head with great retention. Red mahogany body. Cherries, oak, red fruit, alcohol, cloves, grass/bay leaves, malt, red wine. Bittersweet and savoury. Dry finish. Well carbonated. Full bodied.

Bottle at The Sovereign served in a goblet. Dark amber brown with beige head. Aromas of raisins, caramel, plums. Tastes of raisins, malt, grain, caramel, toast, yeast. Medium body with a dry finish. Very nice.
Profumata, caramello e frutta bel corpo schiuma compatta e persistente. Un grande classico

33 cl bottle poured in to a Trappist glass. Dark amber colour with a creamy off-white head. Sweet aroma with caramel malts, yeasts, subtle liquorice hints, tart apples, toffee, chocolate, cough drops and light earthy hops. Taste is sweet. Medium to full body with a creamy to oily texture. Average carbonation. Finishes long lasting slightly dry and fruity yeasty with caramel malts and a gentle burn of alcohol. Excellent Trappist beer. However, I get the same intensity and complexity from a Rochefort 8 to a third of the price.

12 oz. bottle from my Secret Santa. One of my oldest wants. Thanks man! Pours a ruddy brown with a small off white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, caramel and apple notes. Toasted malt, bread, and toffee with a mild yeast spice. Flavor is fruity and dense, sweet but balanced by the yeast. Full bodied, pillowy carbonation. Pretty great.

Unesperienza di bevuta unica. Ammetto. Anche per la sua esclusività.
La birra si presenta ambrata scura con schiuma bianca, abbondante e persistente.
Al naso prugna, chiodo di garofano e miele. In bocca bilanciamento perfetto con una punta di secchezza e amaro che non fa percepire lalcool comunque presente.
Corpo robusto e frizzantezza vivace ma adeguata. Pulisce.
chestnut colur liquid with beige head. aroma of apple, caramel. taste, med sweet, med bitter, spicy. med body, oily feel, astringent, average carb, long finish

Aroma fruta e caramelado. Espuma persistente, cerveja bem equilibrada, dulçor e amargor na medida certa. Sem duvida umas das melhores do mundo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, vintage 2014 (I think) shared by Stevoj, thanks! Dark brown color with shades of ruby, thin beige head. The smells of rich malt, dark chocolate, toffee, and pitted fruit abound. Layers of flavor with a mostly sweet sensation. Toasted malt, caramel, toffee, chocolate pitted fruit more and more layers. A wonderful beer experience.

Great beer. I expected a tripel but it was dark BSA. Sweet dark fruits, malt, toffee, bread, caramel, spicy, complex aroma. Lots of carbonation, medium bodied, drinkable. Taste is sweet and balanced. Great again, but I would prefer Pannepot to this.

Bottle 2013-ish thanks to Ole at Oles place. Pours a murky Dark brown with a small, off White head. Aroma has lots of belgian yeast, macaroons, almonds, belgian yeast, slight wheat, slight earthy yeast, overripe fruits, toasted malts, prunes, dates, figs. Taste is super toasty, more nutty, spicy, fruity yeast, sweet, light booze... Overall i would say that this is the worst top 50 beer of Them all.. High carb, light body compared to the abv.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Apperance: murky brown with great fluffy soft tan head. Gushed from bottle when opened
Aroma: plum and raisin 
Taste: medium light mouthful. Smooth medium carbonation. Plum raisin, fruity
Overall a great beer

At a tasting, many thanks, slightly gushing bubbly head, very cloudy light brown color with lots of red hues, aroma of cherries, prunes and grapes with some funky notes and some bread in the back, flavor of wine grape and almonds, light mellow bitterness. Really good and enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2017 Butelka, warka do 12-03-18. Ciemno bursztynowe piwo z bardzo wysoka, ladna acz nieco mydlanie opadajaca (zostaje dlugo milimetrowa warstewka), za to mocno brudzaca szklo piana. Aromaty to glownie ciemne owoce (zwlaszcza suszone a la rodzynki i sliwki, ale nie tylko, swieze wisnie, gruszki...), melasa, nieco pieprzowo-muszkatulowe-gozdzikowej przyprawowosci (mam wrazenie, ze po ogrzaniu sie wiecej), nieco karmelo-toffi, tez jakas ziolowosc blizej nieokreslona. w ustach wszystkiego po trochu - slodkosci najwiecej, ale jest tez gwaskowatosc, jest goryczka (dosc dluga, w polaczeniu z posmakami), sa powtorzenia aromatow. Niezbyt wiele ciala. lekkie w odbiorze, alkohol dobrze ukryty. Baaardzo dobre piwo, ale spodziewalem sie jednak ciut wiecej... choc po namysle - to piwo nie jest chyba zrobione, do urywania czegokolwiek. ono jest zrobione do picia. a pije sie wysmienicie. wiec z tym spodziewaniem sie to bez sensu :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).Rami Rami is drinking a Trappist Westvleteren 8 (2013) by Brouwerij De Sint-Sixtusabdij van Westvleteren at Muzeum Azji i Pacyfiku

Dziwnie sie postarzal, ewidentnie utlenienie, troche milo owocowe, troche dziwnie landrynkowo-fuzlowe. W smaku lepiej, dosc wytrawnie, cacy

Medium to full witha nutty browwn appeance. Great structure and complexity and a soothing gentle caressing body. Light carb and decent light fluffy beige head. Pretty much of the same quality as the 12.

Bottle. Pours a dark murky brown with a lasting beige soft bubbly head. Aroma of raisins, figs, nuts, blackcurrant, chocolate. Taste is of plums, dried fruits, raisins, chocolate, blackcurrant, fig. Really smooth light mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation. Really good.
Medium dark brown with a lasting head. Taste is lots of red wine and chocolate. Fairly sweet and heavy.

Bottle. North Bar, Leeds. Cap has the date 24.04.16 on it. Clear, reddy copper colour. Very bubbly, yet dense, lasting, pale tan head. Nose has granary bread, buttery malts. Fruit cake fruits. Quite vinous. Some chocolate. Some hazelnut. Smells great. Taste is fruity, and vinous dry. Light, stony bitterness. Soft, foamy mouthfeel. Never feels the ABV. Stone fruit bitterness rises at the end. Very easy drinking.

Bottle @ home. marrone, velata, con riflessi ambrati ed ununghia aranciata quando si inclina il calice. Schiuma beige fine di media persistenza.Aroma molto complesso, tostato, di caffè shakerato e vaniglia, lievito, esteri fruttati, che tendono alla frutta rossa sotto spirito, liquirizia, caramello, coriandolo in semi, zucchero di canna. Gusto dolce abboccato, lievemente tostato, con note di caramello, liquirizia, liquore, e cacao. Carbonatazione elegante, nient affatto pungente, corpo molto debole, rotonda, calda senza alcun eccesso alcolico. Equilibrata e parecchio armonica.

Brown clear color with a solid foam layer. The smell is "typical brown" with a (honey?) sweetness. The taste is full, sweet and creamy like caramel with a well dosed fine carbonation. Dryish sweet aftertaste.

Bottle. Aroma of dried berries; prunes, raisins, herbal grassy, dark malt, melasses, bitter hops, A bit yeasty. The flavours is very sweet and only light bitter towards the finish. The body is medium and the texture is oily. Soft carbonation. A very balanced and good beer.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2015 Kapsyl med 17.05.19. Jästig behaglig lukt av kaffe och choklad, trevlig mörkbrun färg med ljusbrunt skum. Smak av kaffe, torkad frukt, karamell, lite vanilj. Diskret humlesmak som ger lite syrlighet. Ganska dold alkoholsmak. Lång eftersmak av malt, känns ganska sträv på tungan. Len och inte för tjock på tungan.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

330 ml bottle (best before on cap: 19/06/17).
Preparation: Fridged bottle, then cooled at room temperature and popped at 12°C (within recommended temperature range) onto Westmalle chalice.

Looks: Cloudy hazy dark brown with a layer of chunky yeast particels; Half finger head and light beige foam which lasts for one minute;
Very good sticky lacing with bubbly slight carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant and sweet full dark malt, with strong plums, dried figs, liquor alcohol, candied sugar, caramel, strong toffee, vanilla, spices, rye bread, strong Bel yeast, thin lemon and light grass. Not that strong to the nose but multi-layered and very pleasant!

Taste: Strong sweet full dark malt, with strong alcohol, liquorices, candied sugar, plums, figs, dark bread, caramel, toffee, toast, strong spices, strong Bel yeast, lemon and moderate bitter herbal hops.

Body: Medium body. Very slick and quite creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Much like the aroma, its a layered and well-combined bliss of good dark maltyness with strong influence of kick-ass Bel yeast. The dark fruits, caramel, toffee and toast are omnipresent with every sips, closely followed by chewy bread and spices. Pretty strong lemon and herbs to round. Excellent!

Booze and Sweetness: the 8% alcohol is very liquor-like, pronounced and sweet, but not too overbearing and compliment the beer pretty well. Nice!

Hoppiness: Thin lemon and light grass in nose, and much strong plus spicesand herbs in taste. Bitterness, compounded with liquorices, is strong for a lasting, sweet herbal malty finish.

After Taste: Slightly Dry. Sweet, boozy and smooth to mouth.

Comments: As a strong Belgian Dark, this one got a very soulful yeast to sparkle from start to finish. Not as Darwinian as Westvleteren XII, but within BSA this is top stuff, with strong and creamy and layered tastes match toe to toe with the aroma, nice booze and expressive herbal hoppiness. Bold and full of subtle characters, I just cant get enough for Christmas!

Bottle
Aroma-floral, fruits
Appearance-amber, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, creamy, lively, long finish, 
Overall-perfect
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Not a double, not a triple, but it would fit well. Very sweet and boozy, all well done. Very very nice, but clearly not Top 30 as its listed here.

Brown color with tan head. Aroma is candied sugar, caramel malt, spicy yeasts, but not too sweet. Something dusty lying below. Taste is caramel, bananas and apricots (very Belgian), with that spicy fruity finish. Some rhum elements in there. Very good for what it is, and it doesn?t even have too much carbonation.

Drinking this while at In De Vrede on 9/12/15. Well, i actually might like this more than Westy 12. 

Body is a much lighter color than 12, but still a nice dark caramel color. What I really like about it though is the mig malted barley aroma Im getting. Also nice fresh hop smell. Taste, this beer is very balanced. Caramel malts meld perfectly with the slightly bitter hops. Not my favorite beer of all time, but probably what I would call the perfect beer.

Pours deep violet brown with a large off-white head which recedes to a layer of foam about a finger deep. Aroma is raisins, toffee, slight apple, slight rum and dates. Taste is raisins, dark berries, slight dark berry tartness, dusty, slight caramel sweet.

Bottle at home whilst watching Star Wars: Attack Of The Clones. Pours darkest Brown with a shade of Red. Beige head to boot. Aroma is a knockout. Full of Belgian promise. Dark fruit, candi sugar and doughy caramel. Its well rounded and delicious. Not to the point that it ought to be priced out of the market though. The film is way better than I remember..

Scuro color mogano con velo pannoso di schiuma color beige chiaro. Fantastico bouquet di frutta matura, nocciole, malto, lievito, caramello e cereali, al palato è equilibratissima, rotonda, riprende gli aromi e scorre giù che è un piacere! Corpo medio, effervescenza morbida, persistente e strutturata. Difficilissima da reperire, merita le stesse attenzioni della troppo osannata "XII". Capolavoro belga.

(Westvleteren Extra 8) Bottle 330 ml at home, seems I have received it in a trade, so thanks to whoever sent it! Served into a big tulip. ABV 8%
Dark brown colour on the body, very tall and thick, soapy, tan head on top, with very good retention. Murky body.
Nice aroma of dark fruits, light yeast, some caramel.
Unique taste, havent tasted a belgian dark ale like that before, lots of dark fruits, light perfume, yeast, caramel, light vanilla-like flavours, berries.
Medium body, carbonation on the high side.
Good.

Sendo muito honesto, uma breja maravilha. Marrom com média formação de espuma de boa duração. Aroma com notas de chocolate amargo, malte torrado, frutas escuras, caramelo, especiarias e lúpulo ao fundo. O sabor é mais maltado, notas café, surge o malte torrado com especiarias e lúpulo, que fica bem evidente. Corpo médio pra alto com final longo e adocicado, mas o amargor tb se faz presente. Que cerveja!!!

Many thanks to Rian for this little beauty. Dark mahogany with a rocky beige head. Rich rich aroma of malt, plums, and raisins with a lovely silky, candy infused effervescent palate. Huge malt, warming alcohol, some berry fruit and a subtle dry earth bitterness. Distinctive house yeast. Wonderfully complex.

Brown with a green-brownish head. Watery mouthfeel. Faint aroma of prunes, dry wood nd yeast. Taste dry fruit, paper, earth, bitter malt, raisins. Short and dry, woody aftertaste. Easy drinkable, but not as much taste as supposed. But what did I actuially suppose.

Pours hazy chestnut with a nice buff head. Aroma presents woody, malty and pretzel tones. Flavor starts with malt and caramel, and earthy and woody notes come right behind. Mouthfeel presents good body and OK fizz. Not quite as Big Sister 12, but worthy.

Une très belle bière brune, mousse crémeuse. Nez sur les épices et le malt sur un fond damande. Bouche à lattaque ample et puissante, une belle concentration et une longue finale fruitée, dune longueur impressionnante. Une très belle bière puissante et équilibrée.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ (2015 vintage) pours a hazy dark brown colour with an off-white head. Taste and aroma reveals sweet dark malts with a plethora of dark dried fruits, some notes of toffee and caramel, yeast, light nutty, great spices, lovely and smooth on the palate, aroma and taste gets better as it warms up, very nice indeed - even this fresh, but will definitely stash another bottle away and reacquaint myself with this in a few years.
Almost perfect abbey beer. I had a chance to taste some weeks sgo. Waiting next time I could get it.
Brown liquid, with red shining. Large head. Fruity aroma of malt. Meidum body, little carbonation. Taste is sweet and bitter.

33cl bottle at home. Pours a dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of raisins, plums, caramel. Taste has a nice combination of sweetness and bitterness with nice of plums, raisins, vanilla, caramel, toffee. Texture is foamy with lively carbonation. Very similar to the westvleteren 12.

33cl bottle at home (1 XI 2015). Beautiful black brew with a beige to brown collar, though this head is not long lasting or vast. Some flakes drift in the glass, spreading lovely yeast flavours. I could also depict some malts and raisins. A very promising start. Yet the taste reminds me of the truth - this beer being the little brother. The mouth has those raisins again, and some caramel, fondant chocolate hints - strong yet short in flavour - and even dark fruits and blue grapes. The ending is very tasteful, but not that complex and rather short. The palate is strong bodied for sure, but besides the sweetness and warming alcohol, you can notice some water notes too.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2015 Like an easier drinking XII... (although the XII is still pretty quaffable). Impossible not to draw comparisons between the two as the flavour profile is very similar. The 8 is slightly thinner in the mouth and obviously not as boozy, but still has the same amazing flavours of plums, caramel, cherries, bread, ripe bananas... delicious.

Al di là della poca disponibilità sul mercato, questa Westvleteren è davvero una goduria. Nel bicchiere è color tonaca di frate, opalescente, con bei riflessi ramati. La schiuma che la accompagna è di color avorio, finissima e di lunghissima persistenza. Al naso grande esplosione di caramello, floreale dato dal lievito, tanta frutta secca rossa (prugna) e note di ciliege sottospirito. Al palato ha una bella carbonazione con bollicine molto fini e un corpo strutturato. Al palato di nuove note di caramello, frutta matura e lieve amaro erbaceo finale. Ottima la facilità di bevuta nonostante gli 8 gradi alcolici.
25.10.2015- Flasche -0.33 in de Vrede, dunkelbrauner Körper mit beige Schaum, Aroma malzig, hopfig, Antrunk malzig, Rosine; dezenter Hopfen im Abgang -- masterclass
Dark copper. Caramel. Toffee. Raisins.  Rich. Stays on palate. Pretty flawless. Dry.  Drank on Professors porch, after wake, paying respect....Thx for the memories.
Bottle From bellwoods. Nose is fruity with lots of plum and raisins flavour a of cola some plum cereal. Taste is médium sest light bitter. Light body with live my carbonation.

Appearance: mostly clear deep brown with some particulate, one finger of loose light tan head diminishing gradually to a thin skim, spotty lacing. (4/5) Aroma: dried dark fruits, toffee, vanilla, nutty, light chocolate, mild yeast. (9/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate bitter. (9/10) Medium-light body, moderate-lively carbonation, drying mildly tart and and warming finish. (5/5)

Surprisingly light and lively body, with rich and complex aroma and flavours. Unsurprisingly, theres a strong family resemblance to the XII,except that this is a lighter, more drinkable version in almost every way. Definitely a class above. (18/20)

Para comemorar o nascimento da minha filha Sara, resolvi abrir um presente do meu sogro, uma Westvleteren 8. Belgian dubbel menos "hype" do que sua irmã 12 (BDSA), mas igualmente fantástica. Cor marrom escura, turva, com espuma de média e persistente formação. Aroma de ameixas secas, toffee, média intensidade. Na boca, corpo médio/baixo, com carbonatação marcante. Sabor de frutas secas, em especial ameixas secas e banana-passa. Amargor proeminente, equilibrando o conjunto. Sensação de mousse no palato, terminando num final longo, com álcool bem inserido. Melhor cerveja do mundo? Difícil dizer, mas certamente é a melhor das Westies que já tomei (a 12 fica bem colada nela). Espetáculo de cerveja! Que a Sara tenha muita saúde e nos traga muitas alegrias! Cheers!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Color marrone scuro con una densa schiuma beige.Ha corpo medio ed è meravigliosamente beverina per la tipologia. Biscotto, frutta secca, nocciole, prugne. Grande
Toch al het zwaardere bier van de drie, een goede donkere kleur en een diepe smaak.

Brunatne, mętne piwo o obfitej pianie , która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w postaci warstewki na powierzchni. Aromat wspaniały owocowy, winogrona, śliwki jakby z nutą drzewną, do tego subtelna nuta alkoholowa. W smaku bardzo gładkie, idealnie ułożone, owocowe i przyjemnie, rozgrzewająco alkoholowe. Goryczka średnia, ale bardzo przyjemna, krótka, lekko alkoholowa. Ogólnie tak ułożonego i zbalansowanego piwa jeszcze nie piłem, niby nie rzuca na kolana jakimś niespotykanie intensywny aromatem i smakiem, ale wszystko jest tak idealnie ułożone, że razem tworzy harmonijną całość, dla mnie mistrzostwo świata.

0,33 l bottle from ... 
caramel, floral, alcohol, very complex, nuts, dried fruits, red-brown color, clear, frothy, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, slick feel, lively, long finish,
In Brussels.Brown colour. Liquorice ,cherry, plum aroma. Dark red fruits taste.Medium body and carbo.

Diep zoetig donker fruitig aroma bessen caramel vanille. Donker wit caramel schuimkraag vrij klein in vergelijking met andere trappisten. Prachtig donker van kleur met een zwarte rode tint. Komt flink vol carbonatie binnen een prikkelende sensatie qua smaak. Met een uitbundige diepe krachtige bittere droge afdronk. Onvoorstelbaar complex in de mond de smaken spatten letterlijk uit elkaar. Chocolade toffee caramel noem het maar op maar ook donker fruit waarneembaar. Dit bier kleeft aan je wangen van binnen. Geweldige smaak sensatie voor het ABV!

dark brown colour with yeast particles, one inch of creamy beige head; aroma of dried fruits like plum and raisin, some herbal notes, toffee and alcohol; taste is the same with some nuts and hints of vanilla; amazing!

Bottle 33cl. Clear deep ruby brown, small one-finger frothy beige head, half-way lasting, good lacing; strong sweet malt nose, roasted, dried dark fruit (date, raisin), caramel, cocoa, maple syrup, cinnamon notes, laurel, fortified wine and some wood; taste light heavy sweet and slightly bitter, roasted, toffee, candy, bitter chocolate nutty notes, noble alcohol (Armagnac, Cognac); full-bodied, creamy texture, smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation, aftertaste bittersweet, chocolate, herbal and spicy notes, ever present roast undertone, towards the finish more (fine) alcohol gets through; a well-balanced, complex and smooth brew, excellent beer, a feast for the taste buds.

Bottle from Beergium. Brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with citrus, toffee, nuts, malts, toast and earthy notes. Silky smooth palate. Bitter finish with citrus, malts, nuts, toffee and a bit of yeast. Excellent Belgian strong ale.

Classico tonaca di frate per la Westvleteren 8, con splendidi riflessi rosso borgogna; da manuale è la schiuma beige chiaro che si forma, fine, cremosissima e compatta, dallottima persistenza. Al naso, risulta molto elegante e raffinata: pera e ciliegia sciroppata, frutti rossi, caramello, frutta secca (nocciole, forse arachidi), albicocca disidratata, amaretto ed una suggestione di vino liquoroso; cè un bel equilibrio tra i diversi elementi che entrano ed escono di scena al variare della temperatura nel bicchiere, senza che ci sia un aroma dominante. Al palato prosegue il percorso iniziato dallaroma; caratterizzata da un equilibrio e da una pulizia impeccabile. E meno dolce del previsto: biscotto, caramello, prugna e uvetta, frutta secca (nocciola) sono sostenuti da una vivace carbonazione e bilanciati da un finale sorprendentemente attenuato e una chiusura amaricante di mandorla con qualche leggera tostatura. Lalcool è forse fin troppo ben nascosto, facendo timidamente capolino solamente nel retrogusto di frutta sotto spirito. Il corpo è medio, sfoderando una facilità di bevuta impressionante.
chesnut brown. aroma hay coffee cashews. tastes sweet toffee slight grain tannins cherries. monolith of malt. mild bite of booze.

33cl bottle @ St. Sixtus. Brown colour with off-white head. Licorice aroma, candy, hints of red grape. The flavour is licorice, yeast, sweet malts and dark fruits. Slightly hoppy aftertaste with moderate sweetness. Mouthfeel is medium, carbonation ok. Good beer as expected.

Mon ami Ben est revenu de Belgique avec quelques bouteilles dans ses bagages. Aujourdhui, nous avons ouvert cette bouteille à la capsule bleue sur laquelle est imprimée cette date: 16.04.18. Au versement, le liquide est dun beau brun foncé avec une mousse assortie. Au nez, je détecte une présence danis, de sucre brun, de malts noirs, de prunes, de raisins, de figues et de fleurs dalcool et de houblons terreux. En bouche, les saveurs sont amères et douces avec des houblons et des malts, des épices et des fruits foncés. Une très bonne bière belge, il va sans dire car les malts sont superbement travaillés, les levures expressives et les houblons encore jeunes. La bouche est merveilleuse, pétillante, crémeuse, ni trop lourde ni trop mince. Une perfection atteinte, il va sans dire. La finale est bien intéressante, propre, en équilibre, à la fois maltée et houblonnée. Diantre! Dun point de vue objectif, cette bière na aucun défaut. Et dans une optique subjective, un nectar divin qui mérite amplement sa place au sommet.
Wonderful aroma of raisins, figs and plums. The taste is nearly perfect but would have appreciate a little more punch in the flavours. Very dry finish and a little bitter.

Traded with my step brother for a bottle that he just picked up at "In de Vrede". Poured into our Westy glasses, and shared with my better half. Pours deep dark brown, with some copperish tones on the edges, khaki head, that dies to a thin layer that is extra clingy on the glass walls, very minor lace spots, some of the yeast spots on the top. Nose is raisin, liquorice, anise, brown sugar and booze. Tastes sweet, dark fruits like raisin, fig, prune, dates, bitter, and suprisingly some burn from the booze on the tongue. This is a sipper and resembles its big brother quite a bit. I like it quite a bit.

Bottle at in de vredemid cherry brown, rich fruity cola and dates on nose, full bodied, moderate carbonation, fruity, complex, plums, lighter than the 12, quite fruity from the yeast. Not a big fan of either of the dark beers but prefer this to the 12.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy reddish brown with some sediment and an off-white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma and flavour are dried fruit, caramel, sugar, and alcohol - with a slightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2015 Pours thick dark brown with a very thin head! Aromais sweet, cherry, dark fruits and raisins. Low carbonated, taste consists of cherry, raisins , blackcurrants,, sweet dark fruits and plums.
Thanks Steve, youre awesome. This brown ale has a thick khaki foam. A lighter version of her brother, dark fruit, figs, and plums frolic with a slight cinnamon finish. Delicious.
330ml bottle at home. Pours dark red with a lacy head. Very well-balanced with a fruity aftertaste.

Bottle, BB 21.05.18 (from beergium.com). Pours dark brown without head. Aroma is very sweet, perfumy, dark fruits, raisins, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, dark fruits, malt, caramel, toffee. Finish is sweet and bitter with ting of warming alcohol. Carbonation is low, almost flat. Overall: very good, but not great. The bottle opened almost whitout noise and there is very little carbonation. It doesnt feel oxidized, so maybe just not the best batch/bottle.

330ml bottle, from In Da Vrede, drunk at home. Pours deep claret red with a bubbly off white head. Aroma is cherry, raisin, almond, plum, hazelnut, silky chocolate, light caramel, lots of fruitiness in the palate, medium bodied, creamy texture. Finish is quite sweet with a dry lightly bitter finish. Carbonation is soft.

Pours dark with a hint of red. Huge off white head. Aroma of raisins bread and caramel. Sweet and malty taste with a long but subtle bitter aftertaste. Alcohol warming is quite prominent. This beer needed a few minutes to settle in the glass. The difference was night and day.

At In de Vrede along with the 12. Looks like the 12. Aroma is also very similar but milder. The mouthfeel is thinner, more oily than creamy. Nearly as good as the 12 and considering it is just 8% abv it is as good an option.

Bottle, 33cL. @In de Vresde. A dark brown beer with light hues ; medium creamy beige head ; medium retention. Roasty and toasty aroma, nuts, raisin, pear, light prune. Medium sweet, medium bitter ; dry ; light refreshing ; just a few rays of light get into this undergrowth. Remember me a small walk during a rainy day next to the abbey. Medium good body ; creamy texture ; smooth ; average good carbonation ; sweet roast lasting finish. Overall, a very brown dark toasty ale ; good wingspan ; maybe too dry.

Dark copper-brown in colour with a light tan head. Aroma of dark dried fruits, like prunes and figs, chocolate and raisin. Lightly carbonated with a slick texture and a full body. Sweet at first with some fruity bitterness developing. Long lasting finish. Complex!

(330ml bottle from Bier Tempel, Brussels, July 28 2015) Pours a lightly hazed deep brown with a small but dense and active tan head and lace. Aroma has a dry and dusty character of yeast and spice cupboard. Caramel malts are light to moderate, dried pale fruits, cooked grains, very light roast, nuts. Palate is light caramel sweetness for style, mineral notes of wet stone throughout, particularly in the finish. Cacao bean, figs, white pepper, walnut and pecan, moderate to heavy dry roast, touches of yeast that stay in the background. Never sweet, it becomes almost bracingly dry on the finish, bitter from roast (and maybe hops) and tannic minerality that sucks the moisture from the mouth and leaves more wet stone behind. Light bodied and edging on watery despite flavour. Soft carb. This is really lovely, not in the same league as a typical "dubbel" type beer at all. It seems drier, flintier, roastier, and with a special character from the yeast. Really its only the mouthfeel that is a little underwhelming but theres the 12 for that! A real sipper despite easy drinkability.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl à la maison.
Couleur rubis/marron effevescence et mousse moyenne.
Nez assez fort sur la levure et lamande.
En bouche attaque énorme sur la vanille le caramel. Deuxième bouche sur la noisette, continuité sur la levure. Finale en bouche sèche mais avec une attaque sur la levure qui la rend juste sublimement équilibrée.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Bière exceptionnelle, la meilleure de la gamme pour moi. Équilibre parfait, complexe à souhait. Douce et onctueuse, arômes maltés et caramélisés. Génial.

Pours a dark body with a thick head. Nice but flat aroma. Very nice and malty taste. I had this chilled, would have been better tempered.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours dark hazy reddish brown with a big offwhite head. Aromas of dark fruits, malts, chocolate, grainy, "øllebrød", raisins, alcohol, caramel. Taste is chocolate, malts, raisins, bread, caramel, belgian yeasty notes.
Many thanks for this beer to Erzengel. Pours a brown color. Lots of caramel, light berry a a spice. Light dark sugars, sweet caramel and nice spices

330cc bottle. Pours dark brown with white off head. Dried fruits, caramel, molasses, raisins. Sweet but with a nice balance. Malty and bready also. Really great. A lot like the XII but watered. Like the second runnings.
330ml bottle at home. Dark brown color with off white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, caramel, dark fruits. Sweet taste like aroma. MEdium oily body with soft carbonation

These monks are a truly blessed bunch. Pours a beautiful chestnut brown. Mountains of off white head. Aromas of dark dried fruit, dried apple, smoke, a touch of umami. Flavours are toasted malts. Dark fruits. Some coffee. A bit of hoppiness at the end. Fantastic.

Bottle from the monastery, 9 months old. Deepish brown to ruby with a moderate body and a medium, long lasting tan head. Aroma a big surprise, full of dried and dark fruits and fig strongly prominent, more so than Ive noticed before (due perhaps to its slight age, or the warmer temperatures). 

Taste is medium to heavy sweet, with medium bitterness and a light sourness helping to balance things out. Warming alcohol lets you know its strong but without overpowering, and the initial yeastiness drops away to leave a dark fruity aftertaste and enough bitterness to prevent any cloying stickiness. Palate is creamy with a very long finish.

This is one to enjoy slowly, with a good break after before getting another beer. Wasted in a session, this is a perfect bottle for those nights where youre having just the one. Absolute delight, and if youre UK based its well worth the effort of getting hold of a case or two.

Bottle. Dark cloudy brownish pour with a medium light brown tan head. Aroma of caramel, almonds, faint chocolate, dark fruit and yeast. Medium to full body with a nice even slightly warming alcohol finish.

Toasted brown body topped by a creamy, poofy brownish khaki head.The nose is of medium to dark fruits with fig touches discernably emerging upon aeration. Toasty and caramel body with some tannins as well as worty, darker amber malt, caramunich, and Special B notes. Needs time to age, attenuate, and dry out.

330 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Murky reddish brown. Big off white head. Thick collar. Pecan nuttiness when its cold. Much fruitier as it warms. Yeasty. Kinda phenolic. Flavor is equally yeasty up front. Nutty as the yeast dies down. Some brown caramel malt. Light chocolate. Finish is clove spiciness. Aggressive hop flavor through, kinda grassy and bitter. High carbonation. Medium body. Not a style I love, but its really well made.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with off white head. MAlt, caramel, dark fruits and yeast aroma. Sweet, malt, caramel, dark fruits, raisins, yeast taste. Medium to full body.

Bottle BBE 1/2018 @ stadin panimobaari. Pours hazy weak coffee brown with small bone white. Nose is yeast. Licorice, herbs, bread, chocolate and some yeast. Strong body with a smooth and frizzly mouth feel.
Aroma agradável, aparência escura, encorpada. Bem frutada e nem se percebe os 8% de álcool. Sensacional!

Pours a hazy darker brown color, topped with a beige colored head, average size and slowly settling. Malty aroma, herbal with notes of dark fruits and some chocolate. Taste is a bit complex - some earthy yeasty notes, initial sweetness and slight soury feel to it. Mild bitterness and quite yeasty in the finish, with some herbs present here as well. My first experience with Westvleteren beers - not bad, though not something Id enjoy on a regular basis.
Delt 0,33 l flaske. Dyp mahognifarget kropp med et lavt lysebrunt skumdekke. Deilig maltrik kompleks nese og munn med masse tørket frukt og kandis-preg. God fylde.Nammenam.

Bottle shared at Scopeys Croydon pad. Dusty bottle from Fergus cellar. Pours a murky brown with a thin head. Smells of dried fruit and orange peel. Nice Christmas cake notes in taste. A good tasty beer

Bottle at home, 12th June 15. Pours a good looking mahogany coloured beverage, nice fluffy head. Aroma is dark fruits, some spice, almonds, slight banana. Taste is almonds, dark fruit, marzipan, fruit cake, banana, fluffy creamy palate. Good stuff

Precioso color caoba. Muy espumosa al principio, con espuma de color crema. Aroma brutal a caramelo y nueces. Sabor excelente, combinando dulce y amargo. Mucho de frutos secos. Gran final a café. Muy buena.

Hazy mahogany amber in color... Aroma of raisins, candi sugar, vinous notes... Flavor is candi sugar, prunes, dark fruits, raisins... Nice raisiny finish... Great beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from a shop near Delirium Cafe (Beer Temple?). Dark amber cloudy body, big white head. Aroma of yeast, figs, raisins, caramel, rye bread. Strong flavour: tons of yeast, herbs, figs, raisins, brown sugar, lots of malt. Intense carbonation. Good one. Was it worth 15euros? No.

Bottle 0.33 l, Drink Hala, Wrocław, Poland.
Brązowe, mętne piwo o jasnobeżowej, obfitej i trwałej pianie oraz bardzo przyjemnym, owocowym aromacie. W smaku złożone i idealnie zbalansowane, owocowe z nutami suszu i palonym, łagodnie rozgrzewającym finiszem.

Evening where we drink the 3 Westvletsren after each other. 2/3. Bottle 33cl. Cloudy dark brown with a beige head. Now the rye is getting more obvious in the aroma and also in the taste by the way. Lots of malt and some sweetness as well. Medium length.
Dejlig øl. Kun i sammenligning med Westvleteren 12s dejlige aroma, at den ikke får topkarakter.

330ml bottle in Café De Spuyt, Amsterdam (13.50):
Another absolutely amazing beer from Westvleteren, theyre two for two now & Ill hopefully get to try the third beer in the roster sometime in the near future to find out if they can manage the clean sweep. This one was quite a sweet beer with a lot of dark fruits & caramel but the balance remained great & it was a pleasure to drink with a nice alcohol kick giving the beer a warming feel towards the end; excellent stuff.

Aroma: Raisins, Mild Fig, Mildly Bready

Appearance: Dark Amber Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head Ring, Decent Lacing

Taste: Raisins, Bready, Mild Fig

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Boozy
