Donker bier heerlijke smaak, bitter. Alcohol proef je. Mooie schuimkraag. Korte afdronk.

0,33 l bottle as a souvenir from my colleagues trip to Antwerp over New Years Eve, best before 30/10/2017. Looks great: Clear, very dark ruby with a big, frothy, almost stable, tan head. Pleasant, fruity-spicy but not that strong aroma of plums, raisins, dark cherries, port and some citrus. Lovely, sweetish taste of plums, raisins, dark cherries, dark chocolate, toffee, nuts and port, followed by a slowly developing, long, medium bitter and slightly alcoholic and warming finish with a bit of coconut and vanilla. Full body, very creamy mouthfeel, lively carbonation. The aroma is a bit shy but the taste makes up for a good beer although it is not the revelation I expected. A beauty with a fantastic mouthfeel, very round and harmonic even at younger ages. Enjoyed it!
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2015 I may be in the minority on this one but I think this is better than westvleteren 12.
Not sure whether I can add much to these almost two thousand ratings...its a lovely cocktail of autumn fruits drying/"decaying" in a barn, sweet, yeasty and oily.... No, I cant.

Dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, vinegar, bread, muscavado sugar, cherries. Taste is light to medium sweet, slightly tart. Medium body, oily texture, average to fizzy carbonation. Very good.

A belgian strong ale kategória királya valószínűleg van olyan jó, hogy rögtön az 500. tesztelt sört követően kerüljön sorra. Bézs színű habmassza krémes ékítményként terül szét a főzeten, melynek átlátszatlan, mélybarna színe titokzatos aromákat rejt magában. Ezeréves aszalványok, diófélék, pörkölt magvak, szilva és vaníliacukros élesztő illatnyalábjai fonódnak össze, sejtelmes kombinációját alkotva az antik jegyek sötét színezetű karakterének. A szinte borítékolható bársonyosság, az olvadékony, krémesen sima kortyok menetrendszerűen érkeznek, egy Westvleteren esetén efféle izgalmakra készülhet az ember minőség terén. Az már az első kortyok során világossá válik, hogy kikezdhetetlenül harmonikus, szinte utánozhatatlan módon letisztult a kompozíció, a lehengerlő benyomásokat talán pár évnyi érlelés tenné még fantasztikusabbá, amennyiben ez lehetséges. A türelmetlen birtokosok így be kell, hogy érjék a puha, vaníliás-fűszeres élesztős lepelbe fogott, mazsolaborban áztatott szárított gyümölcsök édes malátafolyamának egyszerre könnyed és fajsúlyos szerkezetével, melynek partjait almahéjas fanyarság szegélyezi, s amely ódon kesernyés nyomokat hagy hátra maga után. Igazi karakter, a trappista szerzetesek tiszteletre méltó alkotása, s érdemei bár megkérdőjelezhetetlenek, a nagy testvér árnya óriásként vetül rá.

Bottle @ home. Clear dark brown color. Light beige head with a liayer retention. Aromas: sweet, grain, malt, with caramel retronasal. Flavor is moderate sweet, caramel, with a light bitterness. Warming alcohol feel. Medium bodied. Finish is slightly dry and quite bitter. Classic, nothing extreme, but very well balanced

Nov 23, 2006 Bottle from Beer Mania. Wow! Another fantastic spicy ale. Smells deliscious. Taste winds up, fruity, spicey, alcohol mouthfeel and then smoothens out, silk-like. Warms the stomach mintues after and leaves lacey feel on the lips. Just divine.

Cloudy brown to dark brown, small but lasting tan creamy head. Lots of floaters. Aroma is moderate sweet brown sugar, toffee, nuts, some dark fruits, spices and some yeast. Taste is moderate sweet brown sugar, caramel and toffee, quite nutty, some chocolate, dark fruits, spices, low to medium bitterness in the finish, some dryness in the finish as well. Medium to full bodied, nice and creamy, medium carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2015 Compra: www.cervezasespeciales.com

Opinión: Me ha gustado mas incluso que la Wesvleteren 12 aun cuando la fama es de la 12. Entra mejor por ser mas suave
Kolor złocisty, aromat mocnego piwa, lekko cytrynowe, lekka słodycz, typowy belg z górnej półki. Klarowne, nagazowane prawidłowo.Wytrawne procenty niewyczuwalne.Trochę zawiedziony.
Oh Belgium.... They do what they do. I feel lucky to try this but at the same time Im a little sad because while this is the best version of this thing in the world Im kind of still a little sad.
Im not big into Belgium beers and this beer is alright. Its awesome cause its super rare but it tastes a little too belgiumy for me plus its got this weird apple taste and smell to it.

So.....was this the reason Germany invaded in 1940? Nahhhh. Cant be. They are the home of Blatz, so theres no reason to go looking elsewhere. it would be like being shacked up with Kate Upton, and going across the street to have carnal knowledge with Ruth Buzzi. Doesnt make sense at all. Once youve had a Blatz, youve had it all. Or not. these monks gave up the funk and that is how they rolled.

Or not.

0.33 l bottle from beer and chocolate shop in Brussels. Looks nice, smells nice and tastes more than nice. Everything is in balance and this is very easy to drink. I liked this more than Westvleteren 12.

Color mogano con riflessi aranciati.
Schiuma beige, persistenza avversata dall'alcol ma negli standard di una dubbel.
Toni fruttati come uva e ciliegia; mano mano che si scalda fa capolino l'albicocca, presenza di note speziate ed oleose, sul finale l'amaro del luppolo e dei malti tostati equilibra la bevuta.
Ben carbonata, alcol ben percepibile sia al naso che in bocca, ma la bevuta risulta comunque piacevole.
Preferisco la XII, ma rimane una birra da manuale nel suo genere.
dark, with a sweet and roasted malt aroma. damn fine beer with a mix of oak, cherries, roasted malt and brown sugar.

March 30, 2015. Bottle at home, bottled may 12, 2010. Courtesy of tderoeck, thanks Tim! 
Murky brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is very vinous with sweet cherries, dark sugars, figs, plum and nuts. Taste is sweet dried fruits, dark sugars, very light bitterness. Smooth medium bodied, soft carbonation, easy drinkable. Quiet different from the fresh one.
Beautiful version of a dubbel beer. Dark fruit, roasted malts and smooth finish. Not to sweet, very drinkable.

Achetée à la Réunion pour une dégustation mauricienne... sacré délire. Cest chouette, épais, goûtu... un poil doux ? Relativement loin de sa grande soeur. A retester dans dautres situations. Si les finances le permettent. Mais cétait chouettos !

Cervesa amb un aroma fluixet, en boca és on es noten els tocs dolços i acaramelats conjuntament amb unes lleugeres notes a torrefactes.
Cerveza con un aroma flojito, en boca es donde se notan los toques dulces y acaramelados conjuntamente con unas ligeras notas a torrefactos.

From a 330ml bottle on 23/2/2015. Pours a murky brown with lots of yeast floaties and an uneven medium head. The nose is relatively distinct with prunes, stewed fruit, caramel and a touch of chocolate. In the mouth and its fairly standard Belgian dubbel territory - prunes, plums and raisins, with some light spice and yeast. Very sweet, with just a hint of tart bitterness at the end. The palate is curious - a bit creamy but with a surprisingly light body and soft carbonation. As one of the most acclaimed beers in the world, this leaves me a bit underwhelmed. Its pleasant enough but at A$64 for a stubbie, I expect to be blown away. Alas this is more of a zephyr. Imo, Achel 8 Bruin shits all over this in terms of enjoyment and complexity, and comes at one sixth of the price. My wonderful wife has bought me a XII for my birthday which Ill rate in coming weeks.

Pullo @ BeerNavigator.com. Noin vuoden kaapissa kypsynyt Westyn kasi kaatuu trappistilasiin tummanruskeana ja hieman sameana, noin sormen paksuisella pysyvällä vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on sokerista makeutta, bockmaista limppuisuutta, marjaisuutta ja kuivattua hedelmää (omena ja päärynä tulevat mieleen). Hyvin makean tuntuinen tuoksultaan. Maku on hyvin vahvan kuivatun hedelmäinen, sokerisen makea pohjakin tuntuu, marjaa ja leipää on myös hieman. Mausteisuus tuntuu lopussa vahvana. Suutuntuma on hyvin vahva ja pitkään säilyvä, hiven alkoholia tuntuu joukossa. Hyvä vahva ja intensiivinen belgi, muttei nouse ihan sellaiseen lentoon, mitä hypestä voisi olettaa. Hiivojen mukaan kaato tuo mukaan rusinaisuutta ja lakritsaa, joka parantaa makua selvästi. Tämän ansiosta hype on perustellumpaa.
Geweldig bier gedronken bij de paters in West Vleteren smaakt altijd geen uitleg nodig ??

Enjoy this one on a regular basis at home or in Westvleteren. Poors dark with a foamy body. Less rich taste and palate than the XII, but tastes are actually not extremely different. Sweet, caramel/coffee taste, low bitterness and carbonation. Long finish.

Bardzo ciemno brązowe, z pianą, która błyskawicznie zmniejszyła się praktycznie do zera. Rodzynki i słodki likier to pierwsze, co nasunęło mi się na myśl po powąchaniu. Czuć oczywiście, że to Belgia. W smaku różnorodność owoców przekroczyła moje możliwości rozpoznawcze. Są przyprawy, zioła i przyjemne rozgrzewanie. Mocne wysycenie dodatkowo potęguje doznania. Piwa od Trapistów z Westvleteren obrosły legendą. Rad jestem, że dane mi było spróbować kolejnego, po Westvleteren 12 tamtejszego wyrobu. Warto było!

Westy Wednesday Tasting! Huge thanks drowland for finding this for me and Leighton and Theydon_Bois for hauling it across the pond. Deep brown color, slightly murky with slight off white head. Lots of fruitiness and sweet malts in the aroma. Dry, earthy, crisp, boozy, sweet. Definitely less rich than 12, more fruity and dry. Another wonderful trappist beer.

Pours a large head that gently dissipates into a tight 4mm head. Fits perfectly in the glass once the yeast is left in the bottle. 

Exactly the sort of murky colour you would expect. Not beautiful, but suitable for the style. 

Smells of brown sugar, Trappist yeast, a touch of banana peel, dark plums, fig, soda bread and raisins. 

Taste is more immediately warming; cherry tart with a darker fruit following of the aroma. Brown sugar and caramel appear too. 

The mouthfeel is tight and lighter than the quads, but delivers more balance in a better blend than similar Dubbels. 

Overall, a Dubbel will always be a quad/strong dark -lite, but, as this goes, you can't beat this in the style. Less sweet than many of the more accessible versions of the style. More brightness and fruit. Unlike a Leffe Brune, which leaves you needing more, this sits perfectly well by itself and leaves full flavour on the palate. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Purchased a bottle at WVRST in Toronto, pours a deep dark brown with a full head. Aroma is dark fruits, sweet, caramel, brown sugar. Taste is smooth and semi-sweet. Very good beer.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ in Trappist glas. Approx 10 degrees celcius. Best before 26.08.2009. Having enjoyed a similarly vintage XII a couple of months ago, my expectations re. this "little brother" were high. And they were met! Like drinking an alcolhoic fruit cake with a rainbow of aftertaste. Clearly lighter than the XII but just as well balanced. Sufficient carbonation left in this vintage beer to create a thin off white head but that is not the point. The aroma of figs, prunes and raisins was followed by a smilar taste experience. The palate seems thinner than the XII but is still as it should be and once again I am in awe of the craftsmanship that creates a brew which more than five years after sell by date gives so much pleasure. Given the choice, I would choose the XII as it for me is an ultimate rendition of this style, but boy it is a close call. The last Westvleteren in my cellar...time to hunt for more!

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home, 2012 bottle. Pours dark caramel brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is fruity, cherries, raisins, belgian candi sugar and a hint of alcohol. Flavour is sweet, earthy and slightly bitter. Medium bodied, kinda fizzy carbonation. Finish is bready, raisins, cherries, banana, dates. Not vinous at all.
Heerlijke Trappist, om rustig van te genieten, houdt koolzuur en schuimkraag lang vast. Intense smaken van hout , zwarte pruimen zoete drop. Helaas moeilijk te verkrijgen aan te hoge prijzen
Poured from 33cl bottle [06/06/2016]. Murky amber brown with beige head, decent amount of sediment. Fig, plum, raisin, caramel malt. Full flavour, complex, not quite as much as Westie XII though.
Intense aroma, lots of that over-ripe fruit, Belgian yeast, a little spicy, cloves. Moderately sweet. Very good.
Friend tried it and said it tasted like under-boiled potatoes. I liked it. Dark and bubbly.
Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are dark fruits, caramel, bready malts and is lip-smacking delicious.

330ml bottle [Thanx bartlebier for a token of this oxymoron-tic "frequently rated, rarely spread" type]. Hazy brown colour with late awakening, (and reawakeable) huge, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Rich and complex fruity aroma has notes of morello cherry, plum, raisin, dark berries, yellow apple, fruit parings, behind is a malty film with chocolately and nuttily traces, hints of almond, a swath of alcohol meanders through all layers; decades pass seemingly by before your brain frames only an approximately adequate image of the multifariousness you encountered. Not a whit different is the situation concerning taste: rich and complex, moderately sweet, simultaneously slightly tart and dry, all the same flavours if not more occur again. Full body, oily texture, sticky, at the same time slightly biting palate, obviously carbonation-induced and alcohol provoked. Actually a search for words doesnt really make sense, you wont hardly meet with a satisfying and adequate description even rudimentarily adumbrating this beers complexity. If you have the chance, take your time and find out yourself.
2011 bottle. Very cloudy dark reddish brown. Aroma is sour cherry, plum. Taste is sweet and slightly tart. A wonderful clean and smooth mouthfeel from medium-high carbonation.

Deep brown pour with a thick, very long lasting beige head. Aroma hits you right as the cap comes off - fruit cake, toffee, dark fruit. Taste is toffee, rum and raisiny rich sweet fruit cakey goodness, a little chocolate.

Dark copper-brown in colour with a light tan head. Noses of dark dried fruits, like prunes and figs; some barnyard aromas, chocolate and raisin are also noticeable. Lightly carbonated with a slick texture and a full body. Sweet at first with some fruity bitterness developing. Long lasting finish. Complex!
Prachtig lekker biertje. Met complexe smaak palet . komt tot zijn recht dat u er tijd voor neemt om er meerdere te drinken.

An outstanding beer, IMHO the best in the world. We sampled at the Abbeys restaurant in June 2014, at a bar in Brugges the next night, at home that fall; 2 more cases from the Abbey in January 2015 sampled in Brussels and home in the States. Warm, attractive nose with caramel, chocolate, fudge, malt,herbs. Perfect head. All this in the taste with some nuttiness. A very smooth presentation, goes down too smoothly. Lasts and lasts. I have used this as a course in a dinner and no one complained. We did have one bottle obtained not from the Abbey which was spoiled, beware, get it directly. If you are anywhere between Paris and Amsterdam its an easy drive, you just have to be persistent with your redial in ordering.
Not as good as the 12 but still an incredible beer. Very warming, best to be had during winter (not a 30 degree day in Sydney). Worth every penny!
Surprisingly thin body, but with a ton of flavor. Rather dry, with notes of caramel, slight grape, bubblegum, and slight bready yeast flavors.

2011 bottle given to me by Mathieu. Thanks! 

A: Cloudy mahogany color with a thin creme colored head. Lacing.

N: Prune, clove, toffee, dense bread, raisin, leather, some tobacco, cola, hint of banana.

T: Big sweetness. A little bitterness. 

M: Medium body, tingling carbonation, alcohol is restrained. 

O: Very good 8. Has a lot in common with XI though its not quite as much of a meal in a glass.

Bottle to snifter. Pour is dark brown with a small off white head. Nose is full of raisins and a touch of oxidation (again, my fault for hanging onto this beer). Taste is fruity with mostly raisin flavors. Remarkably simple and lacking in complexity that I was expecting. Slight alcohol warming in the finish. Dry, almost thin, moderate carbonation. Overall, good, but doesnt blow me away. Ive had better dubbels.
0,33l Flasche. Dunkles Bier mit schöner, cremiger Schaumkrone. Riecht malzig. Wahnsinnig gut abgestimmtes Bier! Lecker!
@ in de vrede, westvleteren. Donkerbruine kleur, mooie fijne kraag. Ruikt en smaakt zoetig, zachte caramel, beetje likeur. Goed, subtiel.

Pours a deep dark brown with a thick off white head. Aroma Is dark fruits, raisins, dates, caramel and brown sugar. Taste is dark fruits, Belgian yeast, belgian candy sugar, raisins and dates with a touch of molasses. Very tasty, like a dessert and a meal in one beer.

Tht okt-2017. Diep donkerbruin bijna zwart bier. Schuim zakt vrij snel tot een minimaal film laagje. Aroma's geven iets rokerigs, chocolade en noten. De smaak is solide, veel hop, gebrande mout, donkere vruchten en iets noot achtigs. De alcohol nauwelijks waar te nemen. Olie achtig mondgevoel. Mooie bitter met een vleugje karamel in de langdurige verwarmende afdronk.
Zwart bier met schuim. Smaak is krachtig, hopig bitter, lichte rook en bittere chokolade met sporen van drop en anijs. Blijft lang hangen. Erg goed bier.

Pours murky brown. Nutty, caramel, pecans, and malty nose. Taste is caramel, brown sugar, malty, and nuts. Solid!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Een hele goede trappist met een mooie vaste schuimkraag en een mooie donkere kleur met een wat zoete/caramelachtige afdronk. Door het wat lagere alcoholpercentage drinkt deze wat makkelijker als de Westvleteren 12

Bottle from Belgium pours a murky reddish brown without any head. Aroma of grapes raisins dried cherries. Taste is sweet candied raisins. Medium body and a medium high carb. Good stuff but not amazing.
Bottle thankful to artmcd8. Poured hazy dark brown. Aroma full of sweet raisin. Med carb med bod. Taste is quite sweet with grape raisin taste.

Color caoba oscuro con reflejos rojizos, espuma beige densa. Aromas de frutos rojos, mermelada, melaza, azúcar moreno. Cuerpo denso y maltoso con nicio dulce de frutos confitados, azúcar moreno y una ligera acidez que dur hasta el regusto. Muy rica.

Bottiglia 33cl regalo!
Color ruggine con bella schiuma.
Odor di miele.
Corpo non troppo pesante, carbonazione fine.
Amara e abbastanza beverina, a tratti balsamica

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Bottle: Muddy, nearly opaque brown with a mahogany glaze; foamy, khaki head skims the top & settles as a soapy collar. Aroma of some slightly musty black cherry skins, dates, & prunes, though far on the sweeter side of the spectrum. Fruity esters, light licorice, clove, rotten banana mash, spicy Belgian yeast, & some sweet Candi sugar notes. Lightest tough of phenols. Flavor is earthy & slightly bitter up front with a good, pronounced hoppiness. Candi sugar lightens things up, adding some sweetness along with notes of raisin, prune, anise, & mildly stale toffee malts. Bready yeast, clove, fruity & spicy esters towards the finish with a lingering banana & date fruit combo. Mild alcohol, does not cross into vinous or tart grape territory as many Belgian dubbels (or strong ales) do. Nice stuff, although I prefer Bernardus Prior 8.

0.33l bottle. Reddish brown body, light brown head. The aroma is weaker than what I expected. It has some cocoa, bread and yeast notes. Taste of cocoa, caramel, yeast, plums and reisins. Medium bodied, silky texture. Very nice.

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a medium slightly off-white head. Full body with low to medium carbonation. Quite some sweetness with some bitterness. Raisin, brown sugar, spices and herbs, dark ripe fruits and malts. A nice complex brew.
Bottle from Bier Tempel. Deep brown colour, a little murky, thin foam. Medium carbonation. Quite big flavours, sweet malty, yeasty, some spice, balanced bitterness.
Hazelnootbruin, kleine beige kraag. Aroma van rozijnen, mout, hop, karamel. Complex, zoet en licht bitter. Volle body, zacht, licht tot medium co2.
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 A: Dadels, apricot, orange, banana, pear T: banana, dadels, some zest O: extremly nice trappiste! Lots of taste that stays in mouth for a loooong time! Nice!!
Dark red-brown Trappist, sweet aroma with hints of dried fruit, nuts and caramel. Personally, I find this one superior to its big brother.

Bottle from Beer Mania. Dark brown, almost black with medium creamy light brown head. MIld sweet aroma. Well balanced caraml and sourness taste with some touch of sweet, some kind of moderate "dry" sweetness. MIld bitter aftertaste on the tongue middle part. "Dimmed" fruity/floverly notes.

Not so intense as big brother, but very well balanced and complex as well. Quite intense fruitiness, dark fruits, berries, nuts. intense malty background, caramel, candy sugar, vanilla.
Moderate sweet with light bitterness. Awesome highly enjoyable brew, but not as close to perfection as 12

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 Aroma of dark malt, caramel, toffee, dried dark fruits, raisins, fig, spicy yeast. Flavour is medium sweet with a bittersweet finish. Great balance, good full body. An excellent Trappist.

"Sorella minore" della 12, la 8 è comunque una birra di gran classe, che si distingue nel panorama brassicolo mondiale. ASPETTO: mogano scuso, torbido per la presenza di abbondante lievito sul fondo della bottiglia (quasi un centimetro!). Schiuma marroncina con riflessi dorati, abbastanza fine e abbastanza persistente (anche se rimane sempre un filo nel bicchiere). AROMA: intenso, dove si avvertono soprattuto note liquorose. GUSTO: è in bocca che esplode veramente per quello che è. Chiari sentori liquorosi (soprattutto Marsala e Porto), prugne secche e un po di frutta secca. Un tocco di amarognolo accompagna tutta la bevuta. Tutti i sapori sono perfettamente abbinati tra loro, per una birra che non stanca mai mentre la si bene. Carbonizzazione che si sente, ma non eccessiva. Retrogusto intenso e persistente. Lalcool importante è ben nascosto. Birra di gran classe, allinsegna del piacere e dellequilibrio.

Bottle courtesy of bytemesis, thanks Mike! Pours a brown/copper color. Minimal tan head that quickly fades into a ring, but leaving some fizzy bubbles that do not end. Aromas are vinous, bready, tart with dark fruits and somewhat sweet with light yeast esters. Taste is incredibly balanced. Moving from notes of tart apple, plum, fig, raisin to breads, nuttiness and spice. Alcohol is completely hidden in the finish. Nice and dry, with more hints of under-ripe fruits and spice. Excellent beer!

Fles gedeeld met pake, donkerbruin gist iets te entausiast mee uitgeschonken. Geur is geroosterde noten, gist alcohol. Smaak is basterd suiker, spijs, gist en hout. Doet ook erg denken aan Duits alt bier. Mondgevoel is ietwat dun met een mooie bitterzoete afdronk. Bijzonder maar toch wel een tikkeltje overrated.
33 cl bottle. Dark brown with a small white head. Aroma: caramel, plums, earthy, alcohol. Medium sweetness. medium body, lively, long finish.

Bottle, cellared for about 1 year.
Brown, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, beige head, that quickly diminishes to a small, stable ring.
Aroma of dried fruits, dark berries, sweet and sour apples, nuts, burnt sugar, some bread, some alcohol.
Taste is even better for me, boozy, with about the same aromas, also some musty fruits.
Full, creamy, fizzy mouthfeel and it finishes alcoholic, astringent, quite dry, fruity-sour, yeasty and a bit sweet malty.

Delicious! Greatly balanced, very complex, with loads of really interesting fruit notes and not too difficult to drink at the same time. Indeed a pretty perfect Belgian Strong Ale, that deserves the hype, independend of its rarity.

Bottle to celebrate my first ratebeer anniversary. Pours hazy brown with diminishing fizzy head. Aroma has dried fruit, caramel and leather. Alcohol becomes apparant later. Flavour has more dried fruit and toffee held together by strong but warming alcohol. Mouthfeel is fizzy, quite high carbonation. Finish is boozy and slightly dry.

Aroma is dark fruits, red apples, syrup, cocos. Aroma is very like that of westvleteren 12. Greyish brown sewage lika apperance, white head. It is a bit sweet and alcoholic, without beeing too sweet or too alcoholiv. Medium body, creamy low carbonation.
0,33l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours hazy chestnut with a medium head. Aroma is sweet malts, nuts, alcohol and yeast. Flavor is sweet malts, nuts, yeast, alcohol, dark fruits and some hops. Excellent!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle poured in its own chalice.
Ive kept this beers stored for almost three years before open it. Best before 7th of June, 2011. Consumed at 15th of March, 2012 in perfect condition. Completely alive beer :)
A: Pours a nutty brown color and a big light beige head. Fizzy and "alive" carbonation. Good retention, it never disappeared leaving a thin small bubbled head. No lacings and a lot of dark particles floating around
S: Very bready. Very yeasty. Fruity, but moderate on these regards. Caramel malts. Hints of roasted malts. Toffee. Hints of alcohol
T: Follows the nose: Brown breauud, caramel malts, toffee, dark fruits, Belgian yeasts. A bit sweet upfront and a very moderate bitterness. Alcohol sensation
M: Medium creamy and bit molasses body. Moderate carbonation
O: Honestly: Fantastic beer! Despite of the hype around Westys, theres no way to deny that, this is a just another perfect beer made by the Sint Sixtus monks
[ BA Review @ 10/30/2009 ]

Pours a cloudy brown brew with a huge reddish head with good retention, aroma si moderate to heavy sweet and low better with clove, apple, banana, caramel and dark fruits, medium to robust bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and low better with a fresa and better sweet finish and a long aftertaste, very good

Pours root beer brown with a light fizzy head. Aroma is intense fruit -cherry, plum and a hint of cough syrup. Flavor is sweet fermented fruit with a slightly astringent finish. Mild alcohol warmth. Mouthfeel is very full and silky - outstanding. Complex yet balanced.

Bottle 33cl
A - hazy browny with fine head resolves fairly quick
A - hay, sweet
T - mild acidity
P - Full body
O - great full flavored beer

Wow, this is a great beer. I actually prefer this to the 12. Amazing balance of incredible flavours, its really hard to pin down, almost tastes like there is malt wheat in here. Definitely worth trying if you can get hold of it.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2015 I dont even know why you are reading what im writing...
Go drink that beer, and you will see why she just "a Perfection".

Bottle from recent trade. Hand labeled 9/22/07. So 7 years old I guess. Murky brown pour with a small head with big bubbles that fade to a messy ring. Great aromas of berries, figs, dark bread, almonds, chocolate, and banana. Tastes sweet but not really rich. More dry and boozy. Big fig and dark bread taste with some chocolate, nuts, licorice, raisins, berries, and wood. Medium body. Complex Belgian beer but Ive had others Ive enjoyed more and are much easier to get. I might like to try a fresher one some day though.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy ruby chestnut, with a moderate off-white head, which lasts well and leaves good lacing. Port, berry compote, plum notes and sweet spices make for an appealing aroma. Mild sweet fruit hops up front soon give way to spiced fruits and dark plum notes in the mid-palate. Berry notes lead into smooth port in the finish, and there is a lingering sweetly spicy aftertaste. This really is a very good beer, richly flavoursome and highly enjoyable.

Bottle purchased in Bruges and poured safely back home in Florida. Pours murky dark brownish purple with a massive light khaki head that sticks around. Aroma is dry funky barnyard yeast, surprisingly grassy, light spices, with low sweetness on the nose but for some raisins and figs. Flavor begins with a punch of sweet figs and pears and raisins balanced by a crisp grassy hop finish. Plenty of dry barnyard funk here from the yeast. Medium bodied but lightened up considerably by the high carbonation, crisp, with a dry finish. Definitely lighter than its 12 counterpart. Overall a very nice brew but maybe not quite living up to the considerable price tag. Worth trying, but dont kill yourself over it.

Bottle picked up in Brussels a couple of years ago. Its very difficult not to give this beer a high score. Its just wonderful. The aroma is deeply rich, nutty and earthy. Flavor is just about the right amount of sweetness (molasses) maltiness and rich blend of earthy flavors. I cannot recommend enough

When opening some bottles of them, I didnt really discover a sweeping smell, but for the rest everything perfect.

Bought two crates of them a few months a go. They stayed in my basement for three months on a permanent temperature of 10-14 °C. I know this beer will further evoluete to a gorgeous and fascinating beer. Probably not that monument that its big brother, the Westvleteren XII, has reached in the world, but still expecting a lot from this beer.

This beer is just good. It's like the dove chocolate of beer. Delicious and the kind of flavor that you could enjoy every day. 33cl bottle in Trappist chalice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with Holmen1 on board Fridtjofen 08.09.14. Unclear brown. Dense and persistent beige head and lacing. Aroma of nuts, dried berries, figs, leather and freshly baked brown bread. Similar taste, also with almonds, dark caramel and prunes. Very complex and superbly well-balanced. High carbonation. Bitterness and dried berries coming through in aftertaste. A beer with personality!

Flaske kjøpt i 2012, delt med skibsrederen ombord på Fridtjofen: lyst beige skum med liv. Lett uklar brunfarge. Uhyre kompleks aroma av tørkede bær, fiken, sviskeplommer, litt lær og krydder. Smaken er en ren intensivering av alt dette, og varmen stiger umiddelbart til topplokket. Et eksepsjonelt øl med avrundet eleganse og stor personlighet.

The blue cap in the holy trinity of Westvleteren, equally hard to get as the legendary 12 or the Blond. Medium thick, creamy, light beige head, opening after a while leaving islands of foam throughout the surface of the Westvleteren chalice as well as a steady rim. Colour a beautiful dark mahogany, slightly hazy and perfectly fit for the autumn days that are coming. Aroma clearly less powerful than in the 12, but almost as elegant and refined, revealing hints of cocoa powder, candied dates, raisins, banana, cloves, liquorice, gingerbread, cinnamon, grapefruit peel, medium dry sherry, pear... But everything in a subtle and noble way, delightfully blended into each other. Taste kicks off with candied fruits and old-fashioned Flemish caramel candy, clearly less sweet than the 12 with less presence of candi sugar, dryish with medium carbo tingling on the tongue and a supple, smooth mouthfeel, all built on a relatively light nutty maltiness, spicy yeastiness and a rather powerful, peppery, leafy and aromatic hop bitterness setting in already before the finish and assuring a long, dry, satisfying finish, yet becoming sweeter as it warms up. More lean, significantly dryer and lighter on the tongue than the opulent 12, but equal in elegance and finesse. Had the monks at Sint-Sixtus not added more hoppiness to the 12 and left it as cloyingly sweet as it was back in the eighties, this lesser God of Belgian top fermentation would have stood a big chance of having been rated higher, since it was more balanced in those days. Compare with Rochefort 8 versus Rochefort 10... Anyway, its been some years since I had this, thanks to Jan for bringing me a sixpack back from De Vrede.  Ill keep a few in the cellar for a couple of years to see how they mature.

Bottle at Cambrinus in Brugge. Moderate dark fruit and moderate high bread dough aroma. Hazy copper-brown with a light tan head that dissipated early, but lingered as it warmed. Taste is rich malt, chocolate and restrained noble hops. Finishes bone dry.

From a bottle. The 8 is just about everything the 12 is without the extra boost of alcohol. Pours a dark brown/red and makes a creamy beige head. Aroma is of plums, raisins and malt. Tastes of malt and dark fruits. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown color, minimal head. Complex aroma of caramel, banana, vanilla, a bit woody. Taste is as complex and very well balanced between sweetness and bitterness, with a long finish. A great brew, thank you the monks!

Dark brown beer with a medium beige head.
Smell is fruity.
Taste is sweet, fruity, malts.
Afthertaste has a nice sour fruity finish.

Bottle from Beergium web shop. Strong smell. Sweet caramel, dates and raisins. Pours brown with a rich beige head. Taste is sweet, bready some malts and some yeasts. Palate has a thin body and a pleasant, easy feeling in the mouth. Overall you have a high expectation of this brand and even if this beer isnt as good as XII, it delivers.

Bottle. Red-brown beer, almost clear, with a reasonable dark beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, some red fruits and resins, far away some citrus-like sourness. Taste is dominated by the roasted malts (caramel, toffee), sweet, with some fruity undertones. Medium body, lacked a bit of CO2.Not bad, not exceptional.

God øl som man kan nyte smaken av.
For meg en ubeskrivelig aroma, men 12 får nok en bedre omtale nå etter å ha smakt nr 8.
Syrlig.
Rødbrun klar med lavt beige høyt skum som legger seg og blir der. Moden frukt, krydder litt sur lukt. Fyldig, litt salt, søtlige frukter og fin lett bitter avslutning. Medium kullsyre
Gyllen brun med lyst beige skum. Lukter krydder, fruktig, alkohol og litt syrlig. Fin fylde med fruktig og syrlig smak. Bitter lang avslutning.
Gyllen brunfarge,fruktig,med beige skum,smak av frukt og bær,ekstra lang ettersmak,dette er kvalitet.

Bottle. Dark amber, large beige head, strongly lacing. Both aroma and taste somehow very 'clean', in strange ways reminiscent of champagne. Surprisingly light body, sour fruity finish. A very interesting beer, for me in a way preferable to the famous 12.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz at Kulminator with Kimberly and Taylor. Pours brown wih a layer of white head. Aroma is caramel, some nuttiness, nice. Taste is nutty, caramel, bready, nice classic Trappist that is beautiful.

Bottle at Craigs since he noticed I hadnt had and deemed it embarrassing. pours a fairly light clear brown. nose is toffee and dark fruits. tastes of raisins, fig, some toffee, and soy sauce. hint of spice on finish with slightly thin body.

33cl. Thanks Gem! Pours an opaque dark brown with a lasting film of bubbles. Aromas of nearly-scalded dark toffee, earthy honey with the comb, and a touch of lemon hard candy. Tastes of earthy toffee, dark whole grain bread, figs, lemon honey, minty-wooden hops and a bit of unsweetened bakers chocolate. The yeast (and maybe some spice adjuncts?) do a great job of guiding the big malts to a dry finish. Medium-heavy body has medium-high carbonation and a nice balance. Just a touch of the 8% is apparent.
Een heel lekker bier, maar tegenover de andere 2 Westvleterens voor mij persoonlijk de minste van de 3

Bottle thanks to Mike. Pours a cloudy brown with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is a strong raisin, wood, fruit. Medium mouthfeel with strong raisin, bready malt. Very impressive.
Bottle at Craigs, 09 batch. Pours murky brown, nose is sweet, raspberry, raisins, taste is a little thin, sweet raisins, dark fruit, toffee

Red/brown color with good head, light sweet/fruity aroma, sweet taste with red and dried fruit (raisins), light caramel malt & coffee notes, very smooth body, silk, and carbonation, im sorry because when i open the bottle, a part of beer is lost for excessive carbonation of moment (the biggest i ever see!! I dont know why, because the bottle was for many months in the same place)... Absolutely not bad beer!
but, i think this one most intense beer...

Muddied bright brown, off white head. Weird lemon gristle and over chewed bubblegum nose. Soft chunky plum, stewed pineapple and uncrunched pine nuts. Flies very drinkable sweetness, 2009 vintage soft and no real hop bite. Sweet and melted finish.

Aroma: Malt: Medium. Dark fruit, chocolate, toasty, bready,licorice. Spicy pepper from alcohol, Very complex.
Appearance: Brown body, hazy. Large rocky tan head. Good retention. Lacing
Flavour: Rich, malty, licorice, fruity, plum, grape skins, slight roasty, raisin, bready, chocolate, , Dry finish, lingering licorice and bitterness
Mouthfeel: Medium body, high carbonation. Alcohol warming. Dry finish, lingering licorice and bitterness
Overall: Wow! A complex beer that just keeps changing with every sip! A wonderful experience.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
18E. Belgian Dark Strong Ale

Pours a muddy brown color with beige head. Definitely dont drink this straight from the fridge as more aromas and flavors come out when it warmed up a bit. Not necessarily my candidate for one of the best beers in the world, but a solid beer nonetheless.
At the source. Small beige head. Hazy dark brown. Yeasty, candi sugar, fruitiness. I prefer this one compared to the 12, more balanced.
Bottle. Pours murky dark brown with a small tan head that quickly fades. Noses has yeast, candy sugar and sweet malts. Taste has figs, dried fruits and brown sugar.

first off.. my god what a implausible ratings here. shared bottle with a friend. poured a dark brown / dark ruby colour with a off tanned head. leaving a lot of yeast in the bottle. chocolate hints, a lot of sweet candy sugar, belgian yeast, red fruits, hints of caramel. way to sweet. cant live up to its hype.
Bottle. deep brown with a red tinge. a fingers worth of fizzy tan head. Aroma or cherries, raisins, wine, molasses. Taste follows in complexity. Terrific sipping beer.

Had it across from the abbey at In de Vrede. Pours a dark brown colour, very cloudy with a creamy tan head. Aroma is subtle with dates and other dark fruits, a slight malt character and yeast scents. Taste is mild, not too bitter or sweet and really balanced. Medium bodied, smooth on the palate and lively carbonation. Awesome beer, almost as good as the 12.

Appearance- murky, ruby, opaque, half a finger beige head. Aroma- cherries, port, red wine, raisin, brandy, fruitcake, sugary sweetness. Taste- plenty of dark fruits here- cherries, plums, raisin and sultana, cinnamon hints, brown sugar, molasses, marzipan sweetness, almonds, rich fruitcake, brandy, clinging bitterness comes through at the end. Lots of different flavours, really well-balanced. Medium to full mouthfeel, and a soft carbonation. This is something special.

Dark brown body with a dense light brown head. Malty and sweet aroma with dark fruit, coke candisugar and a touch of bitterness. Malty flavor with hints of yeast, dark fruit and alcohol. Bitter finish

Very hard to get and very expensive, but worth every penny and every effort. This is probably the beer with the most complex palate, taste and aroma in the world. Unforgettable. So good it can actually dispense with a label...

(Drinking date: 13 July 2014) A bit murky beer, dark brown colour. Small layer of beige frothy foam. Aroma of ripe dark fruits. Not really intense aroma. The taste is sweetbitter at first, and it ends with a bitterness. The mouthfeel is not really good. The body is a bit too watery, and the carbonation is medium to heavy, which is too much. Overall this is still a really good beer, but the westvleteren 12 is better, of course. This beer is a bit too normal. There is not an outstanding aroma or flavour. And thats why I give this beer a 3.7

Bottle: Trade with Shrubber85 for BBQ ribs, potato salad and a safe place to shoot fireworks.
Cola-brown with a thin tan head.
Bready, prune and cola scent.
Slightly creamy, dark fruit, raisin/apple taste.
Still pretty good despite some age and oxidation.
Even a little bruised you can tell this is a world-class beer.

A cloudy cola brown coloured beer with a thick white head. A heady aroma of ripened fruits, raisins, cherries, plums, plus a malt aroma in the background. Complex doesnt even start to describe this! Tart yeasty and possibly hoppy sourness, vinous and citrus fruit. Then a sweet dark fruit flavour and malt, like a Soreen malt loaf, only on another level! The finish just lengthens all the elements into a wonderous aftertaste. Tasted at "In de Vrede", Westvleteren.

It is beautiful dark caramel in color with residual yeast floating around, topped off by a light beige very soft head. Aroma is, like the XII, very complex, though the alcohol overrides the subtle roast and caramel. Though the consistency is not as viscous as one would expect for a beer like this, the taste brings up an earthy touch, but again the alcohol gets hard to ignore. It leaves a nice coffee aftertaste. Lovely beer.

An amazing beer that is well worth the price tag and the effort in finding. I brought several bottles back from Brussels to share with Family. It is unlike any other abbey Ive ever had with an amazing presentation, taste, and finish.

Ruby Brown coloured beer with small head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins and malts. Taste is bittersweet and yeasty. After taste is long with subtle sweetbitterness. Dont drink this beer too cold. (12-16 C)

330 ml bottle @ home. Aroma fig, toffee and toasted bread, maybe some coriander. Pours brown notes with small but creamy head. Flavor is sweet with some spiciness to it. Light dark fruits and brown sugar. It's just soooo smooth. Excellent trappist!

- with thirst, Niklas

Bottle - Brown color with a bubbly beige head, good lasting but no lacing - Aroma is malty, caramel, candy sugar, dried fruits and plum, red fruits, spicy yeast - Flavor is malty, plum, candy sugar, spicy yeast - Medium/full body, fizzy carbonation, medium bitterness, sweet, sweet malt finish - Bottle received in 2011, a little bit too fizzy, really good but a little bit overrated imo

Tasted Alongside Westy 12, St Bernardus 12, Decadence, others, Pours murky brown with big car.b. Aroma is big dark fruits and fruity esters. Taste is full bodied with a slight sweet finish. Probably my favorite
Bottle, dark brown pour with a beige head, roasted malt taste with hints of honey and caramel, has a nice light spicy bitterness to it, not quite as good as the 12 but still a very good beer.

330 ml bottle. 
Aroma is fairly fruity with a lot of raisin, fig, and prune with lighter overripe stone fruit notes. Moderate caramel and toffee notes with some burnt sugar and hints of toasted bread and nuts. Light phenolic notes of coriander and pepper. 
Pours a dark, burnt amber with brown notes as well and a big, thick tan head with a lot of retention. Moderately high lacing with medium small legs. 
Flavor has a light sweetness with moderate bitterness. Moderate toffee and caramel with lighter notes of treacle and burnt sugar. Medium light toasted bread notes and hints of nuts. Moderate fruit notes of raisins, figs, prunes and dried fruit; all less noticeable than in the aroma. Faint coriander phenolics with light alcohol spice. Some lingering raisin, caramel and burnt sugar in the finish. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a really enjoyable beer with a nice fruit character that is well balanced with a good malt complexity. Alcohol and sugars are both well hidden.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2016 Mooie chocoladebruine kleur met een volle lichtbruine kraag. Ruikt chocolade, gebrand, iets fruit. Smaakt bitterzoet, chocolade, fruit, alcohol. Goede zware iets bittere afdronk.
Pouaaah cette bière est divine! Il y a surement la main dune divinité qui est dessensue du ciel et à mis ensemble les différents éléments pour créer ce produit.
Muddy ruby brown, no lacing. Toffee, figs, brown sugar, raisins, and leather. Mild sweetness with a dry finish. Smooth, low carb, and medium bodied.

Ruby/brown. Medium beige/ egg coloured head. Aromas of chocolate, caramel. Sweet, balanced sent. Nuts. Cookies. Candi sugar. 

Medium/ full body. Very balanced. Long lasting aftertaste with absolutely no bitterness. Some caramell, some nuts and cookies. Easy drinkable. Some similarities with the norwegian dobbel bock. A malt based beer. 

Thanx too Tom Young @ Nøgne Ø for sharing this one and making this my second 100 rating.

De color marrón oscuro y buena formación de espuma destaca en primer plano sus aromas y sabores afrutados que recuerdan a frutas oscuras de alta maduración como uvas pasas, dátiles e incluso plátano y acaramelados como el regaliz. Buen cuerpo y con dulzor residual en el retrogusto. Su alto tenor alcohólico se hace un poco más presente en el sabor pero está muy bien equilibrado con la malta.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2014 Dark brown with a beige cream. Aroma is powerful, with toasted malt and caramel everywhere, well accompanied by plums and berries. 
taste of malt, toffee and caramel together with ripe fruits, along with soft traces of cocoa and nuts. A special one!

Bottle 33 cl from the Internets. Ugly hazy brown with a beige head. Red apples, dark fruit, syrup, slightly boozy, roasted coconut flakes, spicy, some sweetness. Medium/full body, low carbonation, slightly sweet finish. Well balanced like 12, but less bitterness.

Aroma is dark fruits, red apples, syrup, cocos. Aroma is very like that of westvleteren 12. Greyish brown sewage lika apperance, white head. It is a bit sweet and alcoholic, without beeing too sweet or too alcoholiv. Medium body, creamy low carbonation. Not as good as westvleetern 12, but really good.

Bottle from a friend. Been dying to try this one ever since I had the 12. Dark brown pour with a light beige head. Aromas of figs and raisins with hints of brown sugar. Flavor is tons of dark fruits with brown sugar. Sweet malts and yeast in the finish. Super smooth and no trace of the 8%abv. Absolutely delicious.
(bottle) clear reddish amber colour with a small brown head; faint aroma if cherries, chocolate; amazingly balanced, slightly subdued, complex flavour; somewhat thick palate
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2015 De minste van de West Vleteren. Kan kwa smaak niet tippen aan andere bieren in deze klassen.
Tiny smell. Bronze colour, light brown head. Aroma of burnt sugar, malt, some citrus. Sweet and medium bitter. Plentiful but soft carbon. Slightly oily, very balanced.

Aroma: caramel, honey, malty sweets. Appearance: dark brown, medium beige head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: bitters immediately coming up, dry average-long finish. Overall: fantastic Belgian Strong Ale, excellent palate. Bottle at Cambrinus, Bruges.

Bottle at in de verde 

A- pours a deep, dark brownish amber color with a small, off white head.

S- plum, fig, dark fruit, slightly yeasty

T- fig , plum, lots of dark fruit, Belgian yeast, slight bitterness

M- medium bodied and effervescent

D- nice dubbel, very well balanced, not overbearing

330ml bottle. Brown colour with a reddish tinge, foam biege head and aroma of malt, grain, nutty, raisins, marzipan, yeast, dark fruits, chocolate.Taste is sweetish malty, caramel, nutty, chocolate, plum, cherry fruity, yeast, bready. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, warming malty clean finish. Nice complexity, very drinkable.

Bottle, with huge thanks to Secret Santa. This was a giant want of mine, and Santa came through far above and beyond any expectation with this treat. If I ever figure out who you were, I owe you a package. Anyway, to the beer ... pours a gorgeous deep copper with ruby highlights and khaki head that flourishes but quickly dissipates. The aroma is ... intoxicating. Cherry, plums, honey. Chewy, bready, yeasty perfection. A mix of fruity, malt-driven greatness here that I have a hard time articulating, but its really something special. Taste: complex, bready malty goodness, somewhat sweet, but remarkably less sweet than I would have expected from the aroma. Warm and comforting, like city by a fire, toasty, almost meaty, warm and filling. Palate: Medium body, lively carbonation. I could sit with this all night. Overall: Fantastic.
Dunkel gyllenbrun farve med høyt ys beige skum. Lukt av malt, karamell, frukt og honning. Smak av malt, karamell og honning. Fruktig. Import.
#100BE Duft av karamell, honning og eik. tynnt dekkende lys brunt skum, heng langs kant. Mørk brun farge. Smak av frukter og karamell.
Reddish dark brown with creamy head. Medium carbonation. Slightly less complex than its big brother and the finish is less interesting. Caramel, chocolate, raisin, brown sugar
Brown with effervescent head. Aroma: nuts, caramel. Taste: nuts, almonds, light flavour, very well balanced. Different beer. Very good.

The famous Westys little brother. Pours beautiful ruby red with large beige head. Very fruity aroma with dark fruit like plums, raisins and figs, some licorice. Tasting reveals a solid caramel foundation upon which there is plenty of fruitiness, milk chocolate, more licorice, very little bitterness, a bit of spice. Good carbonation, medium-full body. Excellent balance, although personally I would prefer a bit more bitterness. Highly drinkable. Its great stuff but with easy to get cheaper alternatives like Rochefort and St. Bernardus, the whole Westy-Mania is more of an exercise in beer-hunting. The symbolic austerity of not even having a beer label and not increasing production are admirable though.

Denne øl er nemmere at finde i øjeblikket end dens storebror, hvilket gjorde at jeg købte denne, istedet for XIIeren. jeg har dog på ingen måde fortrudt da VIIIeren er næsten lige så god. Det er tydeligt at dette er den mindre pumpede versionen af klostrets øl og det klæder den godt. Utrolig fyldig frugtsmag krydret med en uhyre tilpasset humleprofil. Jeg er glad for at jeg har 2 mere på vej!

Bottle, thanks Staffan47! Hazy dark golden with beige head. Aroma malty, sweet and clean; belgian yeast, nuts and caramel. Taste is similar; malty, yeast, simple and clean yet with a deep complexity. Nice!
caramel, toast, raisin, brown, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, lively

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes dunkelbraunes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig fruchtig, blumig, würzig. Geschmack stark malzig, fruchtig, Gewürze, blumig, reife dunkle Früchte.

Bottle to taster (shared by dudeabide). Looks good for the style; a murky hazelnut with foamy head somewhere between off-white and very light beige. Carbonation is fairly lively. Smells of soft Belgian yeast, mild grain, tobacco, and a touch of dark fruit and leather. Tastes like it smells with a flawlessly smooth mouthfeel. A great example of the style.

Bottle from my Dad who got it from a friend in Belgium. Pours kind of a dirty, dark brown with very little head. Nice body and visible carbonation. Aroma is sweet malt, raisins, dark honey. Taste matches with plums and dried fruit coming through too. Almost port-like in sweetness. Extremely good. Now to find the 12...

330ml bottle with a massive thanks to Fergus. Pours dark orange brown with a small head. Aroma is sweet, with red berries, a little banana and alcohol. Taste is caramel to start. Red berries and Ribena on the finish.
I had it with other two beers of Westvleteren, 12 & Blond. Let's just say 8 is the original version of 12.

Sigh, this is last of the six bottles I brought back from In de Vrede. Cellared since September 2012. Sorry to see them go, but they did go to a good place. (That place being my belly.) Pours a dark cola colour, but opaque, Good visible carbonation, but it doesnt result in much head, a little off white ringing the glass. Dough and yeast on the nose, with a hint of alcohol. Roasted malt with bread on the first sip, with a flow of booze. Sweet finish, that doesnt leave much aftertaste, mostly just that booze. No doubt a very good beer. One of the best beer in the world? No, but I certainly dont fault anyone who might think so.
Bottle from trade, thanks Mathieu! Pours dark brown with a clingy beige head. Aromas of caramel, molasses, banana, a touch of clove. Flavor follows nose. Very smooth and easy drinking.

Big head, cherry-brown color. Chocolate, malts, toffee and hints of coffee. Very warm, alcoholic, malty beginning with plums and raisins. Fitting carbonation, helping the beer from becoming too heavy. Malt, in comparison to other Brunes, isnt too sweet, gets mixed up with an enjoyable fresh, spicy bitterness. Earthy, bready and warm malts define this beer, wrapped up in honey, as the beer warms up. Great balance, decent complexity, smooth mouthfeel, medium body.
Got this one thanks to Beligium in a Box. Fairly good for a dubbel like style. complexity on the front and a clean finish.

Dark brown in appearance, with no light passing through when backlit. Aroma is sweet and and alluring. Taste - unbelievable perfectly balanced dubbel perfection. Thick mouthfeel with carbonation matching the malty complexity. Perfect with steak and frites. From notes taken June 6 2007 at Cambrinus in Brugge.
Bottle. Deep brown color with a medium thick smooth foamy beige head. Aroma of vanilla and raisin. Slightly sour taste of raisin and wheat. Sweet and warm finish.

Bottle from bartlebier enjoyed at home. Quite fresh. Best before date is 04.12.16. Pours brown redish color with a small beige head. Much carbonation in this one. Smells of honey fruits and toffee. Comes back in the taste. Got another bottle witch i will store a couple of years.

April 11, 2014. 330mL bottle at Town Crier. Reddish brown with a very small off-white head. Lovely aromas of raisins, toffee and dark honey. Similar flavours, with hints of spiciness. Quite lovely. I prefer this one over the 12.

Bottle @ home. Aroma: a little roasty sweet, a little yeast. Apperance: Brown as coke, cloudy, fluffy tan head. Taste: Round, mild sweetness, a little hay, ends in light bitterness. Overall: Its a nice beer - but to me the fuss is not about the taste. Could never blindtest this as "my no. 1"
caramel, chocolate, banana aromas, brown, cloudy, abundant tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, nice balance, medium body
caramel, roasty, chocolate aromas. appear dark brown with a small creamy white head. balanced between the bitter and sweet taste. full bodied, with a lively carbonation.

Aroma: Dried red fruits, wine, deeds, bit of roast, hint of toffee Appearance: Brown, red glow, cloudy, lots of yeast, off white head, almost no carbonation Taste: Dried red fruit, toffee aftertaste, liquorice, deeds, very nice, i think i like this better then the 12

Three years old bottle. Colour is clearish brown, pale brown head. Aroma has raisins, (rye) malts, plume, cyrup. Compared to fresh bottle aroma has lost many fruity notes. Flavour has smooth honey, quite a lot of malts. Palate is well balanced with light/medium carbonation.
Flaske, smagt hos lars, kloster øl, God øl og smager dejligt, er i min verden overvurderet, men er stadigvæk god:-)

Reddish brown beer with a big blonde frothy head leaving lacing. Aromas of pear peelish Belgian yeast, sugary sweetness, malts, licorice and anise. Flavor has anise, licorice, toasted malts, dark fruits, raisin, herbs and caramel sweetness. Mouthfeel is quite full and quite heavily carbonated. Finish has a medium bite of bitterness and a longer finish with spiciness and sweet maltiness as well as alcohol warmth. Pouring in the yeast emphasizes the anise and licorice. A tasty Dark Belgian Strong Ale, almost as good as the mighty Westy XII.

La robe de la 8 est dun brun opaque qui va tirer sur le rouge à la lumière. La mousse est beige et elle monte très vite dans le verre pour saffaisser rapidement, laissant un petit cercle autour du verre. 
À lodeur, ça sent les dattes alcoolisées et sucrées.
Au goût lalcool est très présent. Il y a aussi un mélanges de dattes et de petits fruits des champs, mais cest vraiment lalcool qui domine en bouche du début à la fin.
Je ne sais pas quel âge a cette bière. Ça fait deux ans que je lai, donc elle doit avoir quelques années. En se réchauffant, jai limpression de boire un porto acide et houblonné.
Bottle from Beer Mania. Yeasty with noticable alcohol. Very complex, syrup, cola, brown sugar, licorice and cinnamon.

Bottle. Pours a murky brown-ish color with a big - but quickly disappearing - white-ish head. Aroma of malt, nuts & caramel. The taste is of malt, caramel, spices, oak/wood notes, vanilla, pepper, yeast and tart fruits. Starts out sweet but has a bitter and tart finish with a surprising amount of alcohol in it. Full bodied and medium carbonated. Its quite complex and tasty - more than the usual Belgian Dubbel, and while theres no doubt that it IS a good beer, I cannot in good conscience give anywhere near 5. The peppery tartness detracts from the overall score (imho) and considering the price and limited availability of the beer doesnt do it any favours either. So far I seem to be having it every second year and Im not looking to have it more often than that. Very good - and recommended ...but also very overrated.

Vintage 2006. 10 ml shared by a most kind american at Akkurat, Nov 2013. I cant remember your name but thanks a lot! Clear brown, no real head but a floating light brown ring on the surface is visible. Aroma is soft, with rich malty flavors, figs, plums, chocolate, banana, vanilla. Flavor is even softer, with silk smooth malty body, more dark fruit, vanilla, a slight roasted tone and some yeast. Very complex. Medium body, low carbo, slick mouth feel. Very complex and inviting at the same time, extremely well balanced.

Dark brown with a large beige head that lasts well in a Westmalle glass. Aroma of milk chocolate, berries, dried fruit, spices. Medium bodied, creamy with surprisingly prominent alcohol, particularly at the end. Sweet with lots of berries, dough, chocolate, pepper, vanilla. Bitter, spicy and slightly astringent at the end. Good, probably prefer it with a year or two on it - the finish just jumps out a bit.

1999 bottle at heeren van liedekercke, belgium. Quite clear reddish brown color, tanned head. Aroma is great mix of malts, licorice, sweet things, plums, banana. Super balanced body, rich malty, plums, raisin, licorice. Just superb!

Served in a Trappist Glass. Explodes into a dark brown colour with a generous white head. Taste is highly complex and tasty. Dominant flavour is dryish chocolate and is actually quite flat despite the head. Very nourishing and a superior dubbel.

2012-09-15
Brun färg, som mörk sirap. Perfekt skum.
Maltig, mycket rik och tät doft. Komplex men något stängd. Sötaktig, fruktig och mycket angenäm.
Smaken bjuder på mängder med torkad frukt, malt och en söt komplexitet. Aningen rostad ton också. Helt fyllig med en härligt, lätt spritsig, kolsyra.
Först i eftersmaken blommar en mjuk beska ut. Mycket snyggt! Överträffar förväntningarna trots ölets mytomspunna raffinemang.

Pours an average frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is hazy brown, sparkles are visible.
Aroma contains light malts (cookie, straw, roasted malts, nuts, molasses), light hops (flowers, lemon), light yeasts (horse blanket, leather) and banana, grape, raisin, plum, apple, cherry, cassis, vanilla and spices.
Flavor is light acidic, then sweetness is added. After that it switches to sweet, sweet and bitter and finally it ends in bitter.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
Truly great.

The mysterious, mystical unlabelled bottled with a blue cap.
Decided to get a bit ceremonious with this and do a 2-Part pour to decant the yeast - the body is bronze, quite murky with floating bits of yeasty goodness swirling around, carefree, oblivious of their enviable consumption in the near future. A beige head holds as a dense inch of foam for the duration.
Spicy sums up the aroma nicely. A distinct peppery, clovey, phenolic sort of spice; somehow so familiar, as if I were transported back all those years to my first experience with this beers Big Brother. Theres more there though, of course - fruits, almost stewed-like, red fruits even; plums, rhubarb, wild blackberry, very vinous. Theres malt too (surprise, surprise!) - cakey, pudding, caramel, perhaps a hint of chocolate.
Sits full on the palate, not as much weight as expected by the abv, but indeed, a touch of booze tends to dry & draw it out longer. Carbonation is restrained, lightly creamy.
It offers alot of the palate - once again, parallels to the 12 are made, and memory lapses seemingly cured - the more you look the more you find, afterall ; fig, date, walnut, red plum skin & pip, clove, black cardamon, white pepper, milk chocolate, toffee, sultana, another different sultana, wood of some description. Actually a fair hit of bitterness, even a touch of tartness and boozy warmth on a drawn out finish - a slightly wild finish at that, but no complaints!
A multidimensional marvel. I daresay it could easily be dismissed as mediocre when put next to other high quality Belgians of the same style, but theres a real raw, untamed unique complexity in this (as with the 12) that others dont obtain, and is really a joy.

Bottle split with Ray Ray. Pours a deep brown with thin beige head. Nose of candi sugar, plum, raisin, cherry, spice, prunes. Full body. Pretty dry finish with moderate bitterness. Taste follows suite  dark and dried fruits, spice, Belgian yeast.

Bottle from De Bier Tempel, Brussels, close to 2 years ago now. Very dark muddy brown with a huge head. Smells delicious - rich vanilla, caramel and banana. That made me think the taste would be all sweetness - but theres some bitterness there. Restrained flavour - a little disappointingly so - but a nice lively feel. The second best Westy behind the 12.
I like The 8 way better then the 12, The taste, the smell, yes, all great, but like soms say, its a bit overhyped, it really is a matter of personal taste!

@ Havregatan. Flaska från Mikkeller Bottle Shop, Köpenhamn (100 DKK). Fruktig med ganska hög sötma, karamell, knäck/toffee?, vaniljtoner, alkohol, maltig, jästtoner, perfekt beska, fyllig och len. Avslutningen är fruktig, torr och hyfsat lång

Poured a clear dark amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast and red berry fruit. The flavour is moderate sweet moderate bitter with a smooth fruit yeast light hop bitter palate and a short bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Its nice enough, but not that much better that Westmalle Dubbel and to be honest, there would probably be times when I preferred the Westmalle. I dont get the Westy hype im afraid. This isnt anything to write home about.
UPDATED: DEC 5, 2014 It doesnt get any better than this. Drinking with my mate in Scheveningen at the moment. Love the taste, the look, the feel. Gotta drink when you can.
Drank from tap with Thijs and John at the pub near the abbey 22-2-2014. Less deep than the 12. Salmanak taste is a bit more pronounced. Less sweet and fewer carbonation.
Bought at de Bierkoning in Amsterdam. The beer does live up to its reputation. Nice balanced flavours and aftertaste. Now on to the XII.

330ml bottle 2013 years vintage, poured into a Westvleteren Trappist glass. Appearance is cloudy dark mahogany with a small thick tan head with good retention, that left a little lacing when reduced. Aroma of black currants, dates, figs and spices. Flavours of black currant, figs, plums, caramel, muscovado and spices. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. An excellent Belgian strong ale, quite similar flavour profile as Westvleretens XII, but the Extra 8 is mellower and less complicated.

Javais aucun souvenir davoir cette bouteille là chez nous, aussi bien louvrir et en faire un vague souvenir. En prenant une première respiration, jai limpression que le souvenir ne sera pas si vague. Cannelle, sucre candi, sirop de moine, mélasse tourbillonnent dans un vortex de sucres cannibales. Tout ce qui reste dans la bouche après un gorgée de ce liquide aérien cest une noble membrane qui hurle pour une récidive.

Pours murky cola brown with nice large tan frothy head. Smell is amazing - sweet caramel, marzipan, dark fruits, cream, bread & alcohol. The taste is quite complex - sweet first up with toffee, dates, alcohol, then a strong malty/bready backbone, drying out in the finish with pistachio notes. The mouthfeel is thinner than expected but surprisingly still very nice & creamy. A very good beer worthy of most of the hype, possibly unfairly compared to its sublime big brother. The aroma was the biggest highlight of this excellent ale for me.
bottle a dark brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts dry fruits yeast spicy some hops and liqueur flavor malts dry fruits spicy liqueur fruits and hops

Westmalle dubbel taste's equal or better and is easier to get. Tried the WestVleteren 8 to see how the ordening process works. Spent half à day to get through to the office and it took me à day for travveling to and back again which was worthwile, but the beer itself is to my opinion overrated. Wil start the whole process again in à few months and go for the 12. See how that one will taste.
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Very nice and tastfull beer, better aftertaste than Westvleteren XII. Not so sweet but a good richfull aroma.

Pours dark reddish-brown with sparse, white froth. Nose is an aromatic, farmhouse cider thing; apples and spices. Taste is like semi-dry champagne with an apple cider twist. Medium body, astringent finish. Not as good as people make it out to be, but good nonetheless.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Embotellada en el 2010. Caramelo y frutos secos todo perfectamente integrado. Maltosa y sutil. Una cerveza redonda que entra sola
Bottle. Brown with small beige head. Aroma of fruits (raisins and plums) and a slight tartness. Medium body with notes of nut, dark fruits, malt notes, and chocolate. Has a slight alcohol finish.

Westvleteren is legendary, but I am not the biggest fan of #8. Bready malts, with some dark fruit, and candy sweetness. Rich and warming. Malt-heavy and sweet, which is not really my style. Pretty good, but with nowhere near the depth or complexity of #12.

Bottle, many thanks to andregoncalves, cheers! Láhev 500 ml. Aroma je výrazně navinulé s lehkým nádechem tofifé lehačky a oříků. Pěna je světlejí hnědé barvy, nízká, hrubí konzistence a bohuel i rychle mizící. Barva samotného piva je tmaví hnědá a silně kalná. Pivo má střední říz. Chuť je překvapivě jemná a velmi vyváená, má lehký kolový nádech s velmi jemnými podtóny burákového másla a lesního ovoce, celková chuť je prostoupena lehkým alkoholovým nádechem, fini je velmi jemný, nepříli hořký a zanechává jen slabou stopu. Jedná se o vskutku zajímavý chuťový záitek i kdy musím říct e jsem čekal jetě lehce víc, ale i tak se jedná o velmi kvalitní a chutné pivo.

Pours in dark almost black colour, against the light hazy. The head is tan, medium and long lasting, creamy. Aroma is little bit roasty upfront, with coffee and cacao tones following. Dried plums, toffee hints. Interesting how alcohol plays into the aroma balance here, havent seen it before. Aroma is fruity sweet, pistachio notes, very light fruity hops. Amazing balance, all comes together, even carbonation. This is for me much better than the overrated XII. Body is very light, elegant, dry texture, medium gentle carbonation.

Pours deep brown with light tan head. Good lacing, alcohol, caramel, nut, dark dried fruit (more so than the XII), cereal and coffee nose. Slightly sweet with alcohol warmth up front. Medium body with a slightly bitter finish.

33 cl bottle @home from Etre Gourmet. Pours very dark brown with a small brown head that leaves quickly.Aroma of toffee, almonds, plums and prune. Flavor of darkfruits and nuts. Full bodied with a creamy texture.Very well balanced bitterness and sweetness. Not that heavy on the alcohol as WV12 and I think this is a bit better.

Bottle from Michael Noggin - Cheers! April 2009 bottle drank on 31-Dec-2013. This is a very dark brown hazy beer that pours with a quicky disappearing large foamy head. It has strong, rich plum and currant flavours, treacle notes with sherry on the warming spicy finish. Excellent depth of flavours.

Bottle from Timo from a trade 2 years ago, poured a burnt clear copper color with phenol alcohol aromas, light burn caramel with some light dark fruit. Flavors follow suit with some nice booziness in the aftertaste.

0,33l bottle (shared.)
Appearance: Dark mahogany with moderate head.
Taste: aromas of dark sweet fruit, caramel, spice and roasted malts, slight wood.
Taste: A bit different aroma starts out with a fine medium sweet malty taste and some (dried) red fruit (some faintcherries in the addition of plums and raisins) followed by some spices and chocolate.
Medium bitter. Very nicely balanced in the taste region while still having a nice complexity.
Medium carbonation,really nice creamy texture, medium body.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 Old rating rerated 24.12.2013, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice slightly brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh fruity, mild brett, citrus peel, dark malts, sorrel, burnt caramel, hay, hints of coffee and chocolate. Taste is slightly fresh and dry, mild brett, dark malts, alcohol, grass, burnt caramel, citrus peel, hay, hints of coffee. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very nice.
Poured an extremely fizzy dark brown. Head dissipated quick. Aromas are earthy with dark fruit notes. Mild taste with fizzy mouthfeel, champagne-like. A bit thin.
Drank quite a young one. Strong candi, and some rubber and leather aromas. Should get better with age.

MHD: 06.04.14 
Dunkelbraun-trüb ergießt es sich ins Glas, beige-brauner Schaum mit einer tollen Toffee-Note. 
Der Geruch ist malzig-vollmundig-interessant. 

Der Antrunk ist sehr herb-betont und malzig. Ich denke, die Herbe lässt mit der Zeit nach, aber dieses Bier ist ja noch sehr frisch. 
Sehr toll ausgewogen. Malzig-mild-weich, schöne Toffee-Noten, und dazu eine recht raue Herbe, die mir aber sehr gut gefällt. Sie erinnert mich ein Bisschen an die Herbe der Düsseldorfer Altbiere wie Uerige oder Füchschen, die ja auch über den Malzkörper dominierend wirkt. 

Der Nachgeschmack ist sehr sehr lang. Einerseits die malzig-weiche und angenehm malzsüße Toffee-Note, andererseits die charakteristische Herbe, die im letzten Teil des Nachgeschmacks dann doch noch die Oberhand gewinnt. 

--> Ein tolles Bier!


Test vom 5.7.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,15,13,14,12,15 - 14,10

330 ml bottle. 2011 vintage? Pours a dark mahogany with moderate head. Rich aromas of dark sweet fruit, caramel, spice and roasted malts. Flavors are somewhat sweet and fruity, with elements of dark raisins, figs, and Christmas pudding spices.Beautiful balance. Smooth.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2013 Bottle thanks to Martinus, thanks a lot! Pours a hazy brown with a medium white head that leaves great lacing. Nose is full or dark fruits, raisins for the most part with some spicy undertones. Taste is sweet but less so than your usual dubbel with a higher level of bitterness too. Flavors of candi sugar and dark brown sugar. Some spicy/sweet finish that I dont really appreciate. Carbonation is a bit too high if you ask me and enhances the drying sensation. Body is medium. Glad to have been able to sample this but I will stick to my classics for now.

Purchased and consumed in Brussels. 
Cap date: 08.10.13

A: pours a beautiful hazelnut ale with exceptional clarity. 2 fingers of peanut skin skIn foam falls soo slow and even then leaves a wonderful stack of quilted equivalence of the same. Near sheet lacing. 

S: first thought: buttered popcorn and vanilla beans. As it warms some praline, raisin come thru, but nothing to save it. 

T: alcohol is very forward here. Solvent. Some graham, dark prunes, but the alcohol is very evident. Not impressed. 

M: creamy as fuck. Great resonance and the finish is silken. Really like the feel here. The carbonation is immediate, passive and constant. Its really fine bubbles that create the exceptional feel. 

O: not the worst dubbel Ive had, where it disappoints is in the wrong places.

Serving type: bottle

06-22-2011

Shared a 33cl bottle directly from the abbey. Pours a hazy brown colour with a off-white head. Aroma has nuts, light yeast, bread, leather and earthy. Average and lively carbonation and medium body. Taste is bitter with sweet notes. Complex and two dimensional. Very balanced. Overall, is a very good beer and thank goodness I have a few more...
Au nez cest de la pomme fraiche à 80%, suivie 15 % de tarte tartin (pomme caramélisées +sucres cuits) + 5% dépices et de céréals. Cest une bonne bière mais cest pas non plus le fantasme absolue!!

Bottle shared with harrisoni at the Westvleteren St. Sixtus cafe. Very dark brown, slight off white head. Nose is caramel, brown sugar, lots of plums, dried date. Taste is very plummy, dried date, brown sugar, caramel. On the finish its got some lovely tingly hops on the tongue, with some slight citrous, sweet brown sugar and sweet dark fruit. The carbonation on this is very smooth and creamy too. Its softer than Westy 12 and the reduced alcohol means you can appreciate the fruit and sweetness more. I think its probably as good as Westy 12. These really are superb beers.

Bob, thanks for the incredible trade. Dark brown / plum color. Aroma of sweet dark fruits and bananna. Almost like a dark fruit smoothie. Taste is belgian yeast banana and dark fruit. Very smooth and drinkable. Not my favorite style but definately good for the style. I think i like it better than the 12.
Cerveza trapista oscura. Color oscuro y sabor presento al final. Tremenda cerveza. Cheers

Bottle split with the family. Aroma is dates, nuts, and mince pie. Pours hazy brown with great carbonation and a big fast head. Taste is dates, banana peel, pistachios, and vodka (without the booze). Wonderfully complex and not overbearing on the clovey Belgian yeast. Super easy to take down and remarkably delicious. This was not over-hyped.

Presque pas de mousse, nez alcoolisé et soupçon de vanille. Entrée de bouche agréable et douce. Ronde et bonne persistance en bouche. Très agréable, très bien équilibré et très bonne. Une valeur sûre.

Dark brown colour, murky. Beige big head. Had lumps of yeast (and?) at the bottom of the bottle. Strong rich flavour of a monastery beer multiplied by ten. Enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2014 17/11/2013. Bottle with date 16/5/15. Oppressive aroma of candy and sheep leather like an old pauillac. Easier to drink than the 12 with still a perfect balance. This batch is indeed better than the 2 Westvleteren 12 opened in the same tasting. Another bottle on  22/8/2014: it has now developped chocolate and honey aromas. still an incredible length but less strength. feels like there s almost no alcohol. down from 4,8 to 4,7.

Dark brown, big white head. Raisins, plums, caramel, syrup, some liquorice. Medium sweetness, light bitterness towards the end. Very complex and balanced, alcohol doesnt hit quite as strongly as with the WV12, therefore is perhaps even better. Could well be the best among the Trappist beers.
Dark brown, beige head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of caramel and dark chocolate. Sweet with bitter finish. Well made beer but nothing exceptional.

Bottle at de vrede. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma is moderate sweet, dried fruit. Taste is low bitterness, medium sweetness, alcohol spiceness, dried fruit, hint of molases. A full bodied beer which is highly drinkable. Perfect.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2014 Brown, hazy, moderate to small off-white foam; quite complex aroma, black fruits, chocolate, wood; medium sweet, medium(-) bitter; full body, smooth, creamy feel, average carbonation, long bittersweet finish;
Overall: very delicate and smooth yet very complex in aroma and mouthfeel; great beer
Spicy dark brown malty, ryeish dry bread with some woody and candi tones. chocolate and leather, dry well malty. Body medium. Tasty, complex. Lots of flavours. nice beer

33cl bottle into proper glass. At the vrede. Westvleteren.

Appearance. Chocolate brown with white head. Frothy. 

Aroma: picking up so wine and caller notes. Slightly sour finish. 

Taste: semi sweet with slightly sour finish. 

Palate: medium full body. Oily texture. Long finish. 

Overal, similar flavor profile to the 12 with less complexity and flavor.

Discrete light tan carbonation over a medium dark amber colour. Aroma intensity well beyond medium of malt, animal and herbal characteristics, hints of meat and sausage and a sour slightly dirty element. Quite intriguing. Strong contrast to the palate which offers a smooth well balanced discretely sweet finely textured malty taste, very complex with impressions including biscuit, coffee, mocha, dried fruits.. childhood ice cream memories. A distant sourness lingers on the tongue. Then returning to the meaty nose, it all makes for a very memorable drinking experience.

330ml bottle from the Monastery cafe about 6 months ago, drunk from my Abdij St Sixtus glass I picked up from a Flanders flea market for about 50p. Only realised through a conversation with some fellow beer geeks earlier today that I hadnt rated this. So what better excuse to crack open a bottle (after a crazy busy day) and write some words about it. Lovely brooding, tantalising darkness, beautifully soft body, delicately sweet with an exquisite fragrance and refined character. When rating this I was finding it hard to think of a reason not to give it less than full marks. I prefer other beers of this style, but this is still perfection in a glass.

Great copper hue, with a fleating lacy head. Malty, yeasty aroma, with a hint of fruity alcohol. Full or flavor and very robust body. Great malty notes accompanied by fruit and grains, most noticable were plums, oats and wheat. Fizzy on the tongue and yeasty at the finish. Overall an excellent brew.
Old rating. Bottle drank at Cafe buitenlust, Oirschot. Copper to brown color, nice malty and caramel aroma and taste. Full body. Nice.
From abbey in April. Opened October. Distinctive yeast and malt characterize Westy but the 8 is a bit more delicate in response to age than I expected. It softened significantly over six months.
Just like its bigger brother this one is deep brown colored as well. Quite a strong character and very nice flavor. Cheers

Dunkelbraun (gleich wie nr. 12), trüb, gewisser caramel und getrocknete beeren im aroma, geschmack malzig, gehaltvoll und nach caramel, abgang sehr gut ausgewogen, feinherb, insgesamt ähnlich wie nr. 12. etwas feiner und evtl weniger komplex

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle dated Aug. 13th, 2012. Meh..... Smells like wet dog. Not impressed. Dark brown color with small creamy head. Kind of a weak body with an alcohol type flavor.
